channel.title: KillBait - News highlights delivered clearly and responsibly—no clickbait, no sensationalism.
channel.description: KillBait is a news aggregator developed by students and professionals in journalism and web development from Argentina, Spain, and the United Kingdom. Our focus is on providing readers with clear, concise, and relevant summaries of each news story.

item.title: What is KillBait?
item.description: Surely you've clicked on a news article with an eye-catching or sensational headline...

item.title: How KillBait works
item.description: Our editors, along with any registered user, can submit news they find interesting simply by providing the URL to the system.

item.title: Upcoming news
Epstein's Unsuccessful Attempts to Arrange Meetings with Putin Revealed in Documents
item.description: Recent document releases related to Jeffrey Epstein, totaling millions of pages, have revealed his repeated efforts to establish contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin, primarily between 2013 and 2018. Epstein persistently sought meetings through intermediaries, notably Thorbjørn Jagland, former Norwegian Prime Minister and Council of Europe Secretary General, proposing discussions on Western investment in Russia, economic solutions, geopolitics, or private dinners. Emails show Epstein following up over years, sometimes referencing current events like the MH17 crash to adjust timing, but there is no evidence of any positive response from Russian authorities, no direct communication with Putin, no meetings, and no Kremlin involvement. The Kremlin has denied receiving any such offers. The article critiques Western media outlets for hyping these findings into sensational claims—such as Epstein having 'direct access' to the Kremlin, cryptic ties, or working as a Russian informant (e

item.title: Britney Spears Expresses Fear of Her Family and Gratitude for Surviving Past Treatment in New Instagram Post
item.description: On February 4, 2026, Britney Spears shared a deeply personal Instagram post reflecting on themes of connection, isolation, and family trauma. The 44-year-old singer emphasized that humans fundamentally seek to avoid loneliness and criticized the idea that isolating someone is a form of help, stating that such actions cause irreversible harm even if forgiveness occurs. She wrote that people can forgive but never forget, highlighting the ongoing need for contact and yearning. Spears then made a stark admission about her own experiences, declaring she feels 'incredibly lucky to even be alive' given how her family treated her in the past, and that she is now 'scared' of them. She described this as part of God's mysterious ways and questioned what message might be conveyed today, while asserting that her family will never accept responsibility for their actions. The post, which did not name specific relatives, ties into her long-standing public discussions about the emotional aftermath of h

item.title: Taylor Swift Reportedly Hesitant to Invite Blake Lively to Wedding Amid Strained Friendship and Legal Drama
item.description: Taylor Swift, 36, is reportedly cautious about her wedding guest list as she plans to marry NFL star Travis Kelce, also 36, this summer at Ocean House in Watch Hill, Rhode Island. The couple announced their engagement in August 2025 after two years of dating. According to sources cited by Us Weekly, Swift is hesitant to invite longtime friend Blake Lively due to concerns that her presence could spark a media frenzy and shift attention away from the couple's special day. This uncertainty arises amid public scrutiny of their friendship, which has cooled significantly. The strain intensified after Lively's legal dispute with It Ends With Us co-star Justin Baldoni led to the unsealing of private text messages between Swift and Lively in court documents. Insiders claim Swift felt 'exposed and violated' by the exposure, creating emotional distance and prompting her to tighten boundaries and become more selective about her inner circle. While the two may still exchange occasional messages, me

item.title: Ted Lieu claims 'highly disturbing allegations' of Trump in Epstein files
item.description: The video features Representative Ted Lieu discussing allegations seemingly connecting Donald Trump to individuals and activities associated with Jeffrey Epstein's files. Lieu expresses concern and suggests potential legal implications, though the video emphasizes that these are allegations and not confirmed facts. He calls for further investigation.

item.title: Jmail Project Recreates Gmail Interface for Public Jeffrey Epstein Emails to Improve Accessibility
item.description: A new web-based tool called Jmail allows users to explore thousands of Jeffrey Epstein's publicly released emails through a familiar Gmail-like interface, making it significantly easier to navigate what has previously been a fragmented and tedious collection of scanned PDFs, text files, and images from court disclosures and government releases. Created by Riley Walz, an internet artist and prankster (as described by Wired), and web developer Luke Igel, the project was built quickly as both a technical experiment and a statement on information accessibility. It groups emails into threads, separates sent and received messages, includes a powerful search function for keywords, names, or dates, and organizes contacts in a sidebar, all while relying exclusively on already-public material with no access to private accounts or new data added. The creators emphasize that the goal is not to uncover fresh scandals but to bridge the gap between theoretical public transparency—where records exist

item.title: Expiration of the START Treaty Leaves U.S.–Russia Strategic Nuclear Forces Without Legal Limits
item.description:
The article reports on the expiration of the START (Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty), the last remaining bilateral arms control agreement between the United States and Russia governing strategic nuclear weapons. The treaty officially expired after Washington failed to respond to a Russian proposal to extend it for one additional year. Russian officials, including Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov and Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov, warned that the absence of the treaty places the world in a more dangerous and unstable situation.
START had long been a cornerstone of global nuclear stability, limiting each country to 1,550 deployed strategic nuclear warheads and establishing verification mechanisms such as mutual inspections and data exchanges. Although Russia suspended its formal participation in 2023 and the United States responded in kind, both sides had continued to respect the limits informally, demonstrating the treaty’s stabilizing effect even amid severe political crise

item.title: Southwest Offers Limited-Time Companion Pass and Bonus Points on Personal Credit Cards Through Referrals
item.description: Frequent Miler reports that referral links for Southwest Rapid Rewards personal credit cards now provide enhanced welcome offers, including a Companion Pass valid through February 28, 2027, plus extra bonus points. Unlike standard public offers of 50,000 points after $1,000 spend, these referral deals require higher spending but add significant value for Southwest loyalists. The Plus card gives Companion Pass + 20K points after $3K spend ($99 fee), the Premier offers +30K after $4K ($149 fee), and the Priority provides +40K after $5K ($229 fee). All cards earn elevated points on Southwest flights and select categories, include perks like free bags, boarding priority, annual bonuses, Instacart credits, and no foreign fees. They fall under Chase's 5/24 rule. The referral Companion Pass expires earlier than standard ones earned via 135K qualifying points. The post highlights that these suit those who fly Southwest often and can use the Companion Pass, while solo travelers might opt for th

item.title: Great Wolf Lodge offers $26 suite bookings for February 6 only
item.description: Great Wolf Lodge is offering a special promotional sale on February 6, 2026, allowing guests to book suites at U.S. resorts for just $26 per night. The promotion requires a specific code at the time of booking, though the code had not been announced at the time of the article. Availability is limited by date and suite type, and at least one guest per room must be 21 years or older. While $26 is an attractive price, additional taxes and fees may apply. Guests who book a suite will also have full access to the water park on both the day of arrival and the day of departure, effectively giving a one-night stay the benefit of two days of water park activities. Frequent Miler also notes that certain Chase Offers may provide 10% cash back on Great Wolf Lodge bookings between $100 and $480. This sale presents an excellent opportunity for families to experience the resort at a highly discounted rate for one day only, making it a rare limited-time deal.

item.title: Targeted Amex Offer: $50 Back on $250+ Prepaid Booking.com Hotel Reservations
item.description: American Express has launched a targeted offer allowing cardholders to receive $50 back when spending $250 or more on prepaid hotel bookings at Booking.com. The offer is valid for online pre-paid accommodations booked through the dedicated Booking.com/AmexOffer URL and excludes pay-at-property bookings, vacation packages, car rentals, flights, cruises, and other attractions. The promotion is available until April 4, 2026. Prepaying ensures eligibility for the $50 statement credit, even for stays beyond the offer expiry date, though users should check cancellation terms as pre-paid bookings may be non-refundable. This offer is particularly advantageous for travelers seeking accommodations in less common locations or independent hotels not widely available through other OTAs. While the official offer requires booking through Booking.com/AmexOffer, some users may also benefit from additional rewards via shopping portals, though the safest approach is to activate the portal rewards after v

item.title: Targeted Chase Offer Provides $100 Statement Credit for $600+ Bookings via Chase Travel Portal
item.description: A targeted Chase Offer is available to select cardholders, providing a $100 statement credit when spending $600 or more in a single transaction through the Chase Travel portal. The offer is valid for bookings made directly on Chase Travel between January 1, 2026, and March 31, 2026, and can only be used once. Qualifying purchases include flights, hotels, cruises, activities, tours, or rental cars, as long as the total, including taxes and after any discounts, reaches at least $600 in one transaction. It explicitly excludes third-party services, gift cards, or buy-now-pay-later options. This offer can potentially be stacked with other Chase benefits, such as the $250 Edit credit available on Chase Sapphire Reserve and Reserve for Business cards for select hotel bookings through The Edit program. User data points from comments indicate successful stacking, for example, booking a hotel stay partially with points and cash to trigger both credits. The article notes that while Chase Travel b

item.title: Spirit Airlines offers 90% off base fares with promo code for select travel dates
item.description: Spirit Airlines launched a limited-time promotion offering 90% off base fares when booking with the promo code 90PCT. The offer is valid for bookings made on spirit.com or via the Spirit app by 11:59 PM EST on February 5, 2026. Eligible travel dates are between February 10 and March 11, 2026, but only on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays, with February 21 excluded as a blackout date. The discount applies only to the base fare portion of flights or vacation packages and does not include taxes, fees, or the Passenger Usage Charge, which can be up to $27.99 per segment. High-class fares (Y, B, H) are excluded and may limit availability on some dates. While the advertised 90% discount sounds substantial, travelers should be aware that total savings will be lower after fees are added. This promotion follows a previous series of Spirit sales, including a 50% discount offered earlier in January 2026. Customers are advised to carefully check travel dates and fare classes to maximize the bene

item.title: Hydraulic Cylinder Repair and the Role of Maintenance in Long-Term Machine Performance
item.description:
The article explores longevity not as an accidental outcome, but as a deliberate design and maintenance choice embedded in mechanical systems. It argues that machines, like buildings or tools, are shaped by assumptions about wear, stress, and repeated use. Rather than treating wear as a failure, the text frames it as an expected and measurable result of sustained operation. Polished surfaces, compressed seals, and shifting tolerances are presented as records of work performed, not signs of neglect.
A central theme is that thoughtful design anticipates where and how wear will occur. Engineers decide which components absorb stress and which remain stable, allowing systems to age in controlled and predictable ways. Longevity, therefore, depends less on preventing change and more on managing it within acceptable boundaries. This perspective shifts attention from avoiding wear to designing systems that can be adjusted, repaired, and realigned over time.
Repair is described as a continuati

item.title: Andreas Lie's Retro-Futuristic Collages Blend 1960s Nostalgia with Surreal Space Scenes
item.description: Norwegian artist Andreas Lie creates captivating surreal collages that transport familiar mid-20th-century American scenes into outer space. Using traditional collage methods, he combines vintage imagery of road trips, scenic overlooks, drive-in theaters, and classic automobiles with cosmic backdrops, such as starry voids or roadways hovering above Earth. These pieces evoke a strong sense of nostalgia for an era that never fully materialized in the way retro-futurism once imagined, blending the ordinary with the extraordinary to pull viewers into dreamlike, otherworldly moments. The works draw heavily from 1960s photo album aesthetics, grounding the fantastical elements in recognizable, everyday Americana while placing them in impossible cosmic settings. This contrast immediately disrupts the ordinary and sparks wonder. High-quality prints of these artworks are available for purchase on Andreas Lie’s official website, where fans can explore and acquire them. In addition to his space-th

item.title: Steve Bannon Claims ICE Could Be Deployed Near Polling Stations, Prompting Legal and Democratic Concerns
item.description:
The article reports on controversial remarks made by Steve Bannon, former chief strategist to Donald Trump, during an episode of his podcast, War Room. Bannon claimed that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents would be used to “surround” polling stations during the upcoming November elections, framing the idea as a measure to prevent what he again alleged—without evidence—to be election fraud. His comments immediately triggered widespread concern and criticism from legal experts, politicians, and members of the public, who warned that such actions would amount to voter intimidation and a serious violation of democratic norms.
Social media users reacted strongly, arguing that the presence of federal immigration officers at polling locations would discourage lawful voters, particularly immigrant communities, from participating in elections. Legal analysts cited by the article, including references to the Brennan Center for Justice, emphasized that both federal and state laws

item.title: Epstein Emails Released: Criticized Trump's Intelligence in Exchanges with Larry Summers, Amid Broader DOJ Document Disclosure
item.description: Newly released documents from the U.S. Department of Justice, made public in late January 2026, include email exchanges between disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein and former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers discussing President Donald Trump during his first term. In a May 2017 email, Summers questioned Trump's potential involvement in Russian interference in the 2016 election—deeming it plausible but uncertain—and Epstein responded that 'your world does not understand how dumb he really is,' implying a low opinion of Trump's intelligence and suggesting he would blame others for failures. An earlier October 2016 email dismissed speculation about Trump being a cocaine user as having 'zero' plausibility. The releases also feature a proposed but never-filed federal indictment from around 2005-2007, alleging Epstein conspired with three unidentified individuals to recruit underage females (some as young as 14) for sexual acts in exchange for money, with payments and recruitment among girls

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein emails viewed Brexit as start of 'return to tribalism' in correspondence with Peter Thiel
item.description: Newly released documents from the US Department of Justice, part of the Jeffrey Epstein files, include emails suggesting that the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein viewed Britain's 2016 vote to leave the European Union positively. Just days after the Brexit referendum on June 23, 2016, Epstein emailed tech billionaire Peter Thiel on June 26, stating 'Brexit, just the beginning.' When Thiel asked 'Of what,' Epstein replied it signaled a 'return to tribalism, counter to globalisation, amazing new alliances.' He also referenced prior discussions on economic conditions, such as zero interest rates being too high and easier identification of collapsing systems than new opportunities. There is no indication of wrongdoing by Thiel. The release of over three million documents highlights Epstein's extensive connections to influential figures. Another key revelation involves former UK Labour minister Lord Peter Mandelson, accused of forwarding sensitive internal No 10 government emails to Epst

item.title: An Opinionated Critique of Western Power Politics and Media Silence on Syria and Iran
item.description:
This opinion article delivers a harsh and polemical critique of Western political leadership, media control, and foreign interventionism, using a provocative anecdote involving an alleged leaked messaging exchange between U.S. President Donald Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron. According to the author, Trump publicly shared a screenshot of a private conversation with Macron, an act described as an unprecedented breach of diplomatic discretion. The author argues that the true scandal is not the indiscretion itself, but the lack of substantive media coverage about the content of the exchange.
The piece claims that the conversation implicitly confirms close coordination between the United States and France regarding military and political actions in Syria, contradicting what the author portrays as the dominant media narrative of a purely internal, popular uprising against dictatorship. From this premise, the author expands the argument to suggest that Syria has already been dest

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Criticizes House Republicans for Silence on Trump's Attacks Against Thomas Massie
item.description: Former Republican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene publicly criticized fellow House Republicans as 'cowards' and 'weak' for failing to defend Rep. Thomas Massie (R-KY) against sharp attacks from President Donald Trump. The conflict stems from Trump's Truth Social post on February 2, 2026, where he labeled Massie an 'unreliable' Republican, possibly a RINO, and blamed his recent marriage to Carolyn Moffa (a three-time Trump voter) for supposedly turning him liberal or disloyal. Trump endorsed Massie's primary challenger, Ed Gallrein, a retired Navy SEAL and farmer, highlighting GOP internal divisions over loyalty, policy votes, and issues like the release of Jeffrey Epstein-related files. Massie, known for his conservative record and 91% alignment with Trump on votes, has opposed measures such as foreign aid to Israel and full protection of certain Epstein associates. Greene defended Massie, noting his strong voting alignment with Trump and his wife's MAGA support, while accusing th

item.title: Earn 25,000 Bonus Points on Your First Homes & Villas by Marriott Booking
item.description: Marriott Bonvoy is offering a promotion for first-time bookings through its Homes & Villas platform, allowing members to earn 25,000 bonus points on their first stay. To qualify, participants must register for the promotion by February 28, 2026, and book a minimum two-night stay costing at least $1,500, excluding taxes, cleaning fees, booking fees, and optional add-ons. The booking must be made through the official Homes & Villas by Marriott Bonvoy website and paid with a credit or debit card. Bonus points will be awarded in addition to the standard points and any elite-level bonuses a member may earn. The promotion period for eligible stays runs from February 2, 2026, through September 1, 2026. While the 25,000-point bonus is significant, it is limited to first-time bookings and requires a relatively high minimum spend. Travelers interested in maximizing Marriott Bonvoy points may consider this offer if they are planning premium stays in homes or villas. Additional information and reg

item.title: Delta Launches Limited-Time Award Sale: Round-Trip Flights to Europe from 26,000 SkyMiles
item.description: Delta Airlines has launched a limited three-day award sale offering discounted round-trip flights to Europe using SkyMiles. Travelers from the East Coast can book flights to cities such as Barcelona, Dublin, and Madrid for as low as 26,000 SkyMiles, while departures from the West Coast start at 28,000 SkyMiles. Unlike typical sales where the lowest fares are often in Basic Economy, many routes in this promotion allow booking Main Classic tickets at the same low mileage cost, which includes benefits like free seat selection, a free checked bag, and earlier boarding. Additionally, Delta credit cardholders can receive a 15% discount on award flights, reducing the cost of a 26,000 SkyMiles ticket to 22,100 SkyMiles. Taxes and fees are modest compared to other airline programs, making this an attractive option for those looking to maximize value from their miles. Travelers are encouraged to book by February 5, 2026, to take advantage of this promotion. Overall, this sale provides an excelle

item.title: Chase Launches Disney Inspire Visa Card with $149 Annual Fee and Up to $600 Welcome Bonus
item.description:
Chase has introduced a new premium co-branded credit card with Disney: the Disney Inspire Visa Card, which carries a $149 annual fee. This card joins the existing no-annual-fee Disney Visa Card and the $49 Disney Premier Visa Card, targeting dedicated Disney fans. The launch offer provides significant first-year value: a $300 Disney gift card upon approval and a $300 statement credit after spending $1,000 within the first three months, totaling up to $600 in rewards that can be highly useful for Disney vacations.
Earning rates include 10X points on purchases directly at DisneyPlus.com, Hulu.com, or Plus.ESPN.com, 3X at gas stations and most Disney locations, 2X at grocery stores and restaurants, and 1X on all other purchases. Rewards are earned as Disney Reward Dollars, redeemable for Disney experiences, merchandise, or even air travel statement credits (minimum $50).
Exclusive perks include a $10 monthly statement credit (up to $120 annually) for qualifying Disney+ bundle subscripti

item.title: Jim and Jane Henson’s Marriage, Creative Partnership, and Amicable Separation, According to His Biographer
item.description:
A new account from Jim Henson biographer Brian Jay Jones sheds light on the complex personal and professional relationship between the Muppets creator and his wife, Jane Henson. Speaking on the program Nostalgia Tonight with Joe Sibilia, Jones described a marriage that evolved significantly over time but remained emotionally connected even after it ended. Jim and Jane met while studying puppetry at the University of Maryland and married in 1959, forming both a romantic partnership and the foundation of what would become the Muppets empire.
According to Jones, their early bond was intense and genuine, with Jane playing a critical role in Jim’s creative beginnings. She collaborated closely with him on early projects such as Sam and Friends and was deeply involved in shaping his artistic vision. However, as Jim’s career accelerated and the Muppets became a global success, their relationship dynamic shifted. Jane increasingly took on domestic responsibilities and childrearing while Jim fo

item.title: DHS Labels Portland Protester as 'Leader of Antifa' in Internal Reports Based on Open-Source Claims
item.description: Independent journalist Ken Klippenstein reports on leaked Department of Homeland Security (DHS) documents revealing that the agency has designated 29-year-old Chandler Patey, a Portland resident and regular protester outside a local ICE facility, as the 'leader of Antifa in Portland, OR.' Patey, who has no criminal charges, has allowed fellow protesters to use his apartment bathroom or wash off pepper spray, which Fox News hosts like Laura Ingraham labeled an 'Antifa safe house.' The designation stems from open-source intelligence, including social media videos where he advocates Antifa principles, and is part of broader DHS efforts using the Intelligence Reporting System - Next Generation (IRS-NG) to track alleged left-wing domestic threats. IRS-NG integrates data from numerous databases, collecting personal details like names, addresses, and SSNs on individuals flagged as domestic terrorists, despite no evidence of organized Antifa networks or crimes by those listed. Similar reports

item.title: Marriott Bonvoy launches targeted bonus allowing members to buy points with up to 40% extra
item.description:
Marriott Bonvoy has introduced a new targeted promotion that allows members to purchase points with a bonus of up to 40%, reducing the effective cost to as low as 0.89 cents per point for some users. The promotion runs from February 3 to March 26, 2026, and requires a minimum purchase of 2,000 points. Not all members receive the same offer: while some accounts are targeted for the full 40% bonus, others may see 35% or different bonus tiers depending on their profile and recent activity.
Although the discounted purchase price is higher than Frequent Miler’s estimated reasonable redemption value for Marriott points, the deal can still make sense in specific scenarios. It is particularly useful for travelers who need a small number of additional points to complete an award booking or who can secure high-value redemptions where points are worth more than one cent each. Marriott’s “Stay for 5, Pay for 4” benefit, available to all members without requiring elite status or a credit card, can

item.title: Flying Blue Offers 25% Off Award Flights Between Select North American Cities and Europe
item.description: Air France and KLM's Flying Blue program has released its February Promo Rewards, offering travelers the chance to save 25% on award flights between Europe and select North American cities. The promotion includes options in economy, premium economy, and business class, with prices starting at 18,750 miles for economy, 30,000 miles for premium economy, and 45,000 miles for business class. Eligible departure cities include Phoenix, Dallas, San Francisco, Montreal, Boston, New York, Los Angeles, Toronto, Chicago, Las Vegas, and Washington D.C. Travelers can book these discounted awards until February 28, 2026, for flights taking place through July 31, 2026. Importantly, flights do not have to originate from Air France or KLM's main hubs in Paris or Amsterdam. Users are advised to leave the date field blank when searching to view monthly availability more easily. While these discounts offer great value, taxes and fees on Flying Blue award tickets can be moderately high, so it is recommende

item.title: Police Treat Disappearance of Nancy Guthrie in Arizona as Possible Abduction
item.description:
Authorities in Arizona are investigating the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, the 84-year-old mother of television host Savannah Guthrie, which they are now treating as a potential criminal case. According to statements attributed to the Pima County Sheriff’s Department, investigators believe Nancy Guthrie was taken from her home against her will rather than leaving voluntarily. She was last seen on Sunday, February 1, and concerns escalated after law enforcement processed the scene at her residence.
Officials stated that evidence found at the home suggested signs of forced removal, leading them to believe the incident may have occurred during the night while she was asleep. A spokesperson for the sheriff’s department said investigators do not believe she left on her own and emphasized that her limited mobility makes it unlikely she could have walked away without assistance. The circumstances, they said, point to a possible kidnapping or abduction.
Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos repo

item.title: Colorado Coal Plant Owners Challenge Trump Administration’s Mandate to Keep Plants Open
item.description: The Trump administration's initiative to sustain the declining coal industry has encountered resistance from within the industry itself. Two Colorado coal plant owners, Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association and Platte River Power Authority, have filed a petition with the Energy Department, arguing that the government's mandate to keep the Craig Station unit operational past its scheduled closure violates their constitutional rights under the Fifth Amendment. The unit was originally set to retire at the end of 2025 due to air pollution regulations, but a mechanical failure and a December order from the administration extended its operation. The Energy Department has defended the move, citing an 'energy emergency' and the need for reliable baseload power. However, utility companies and energy experts point out that keeping aging coal plants operational incurs high costs, which could ultimately affect consumers, and question whether such measures genuinely improve grid reliabi

item.title: French authorities investigate X/Twitter over content moderation, algorithms, and alleged legal violations
item.description:
The article reports that French authorities, with the involvement of Europol and the French Gendarmerie, allegedly searched the Paris offices of X (formerly Twitter) as part of an investigation that began the previous year. According to the text, the inquiry focuses on the platform’s algorithms and their alleged disruption of automated data-processing systems, as well as the impact of recent platform changes, including the integration of the AI tool Grok.
The piece claims that two complaints triggered the investigation, one of them filed by French MP Éric Bothorel, who reportedly raised concerns about algorithmic manipulation. It further states that the Paris prosecutor’s office has summoned Elon Musk, owner of X, and Linda Yaccarino, who was CEO when the investigation began, to testify on April 20. The article alleges that they would be required to comply with specific guidelines regarding acceptable and unacceptable content if they appear, and that employees of the company have also

item.title: Jon Stewart addresses brief mention of his name in newly released Epstein documents
item.description:
Jon Stewart addressed viewers of The Daily Show after learning that his name appeared in a newly released set of documents connected to the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. During his opening monologue, Stewart explained that he reviewed the files, like many public figures and members of the public, to see whether he was mentioned. He framed the situation with humor while also providing context about how and why his name appeared.
According to Stewart, the reference comes from a 2015 email sent by Epstein to producer Barry Josephson. In the email, Epstein suggested an idea for a hypothetical stand-up project involving filmmaker Woody Allen, proposing that it could be distributed through platforms such as Apple TV or Amazon. Josephson replied by outlining a possible format for the project, describing it as a biographical event that could be hosted or narrated by “somebody like Jon Stewart,” or alternatively voiced over by Allen himself.
Stewart joked about the wording of the email on a

item.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi Assassinated by Gunmen in Zintan, Libya
item.description: On February 3, 2026, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, the second son of former Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi and once seen as his potential successor, was assassinated in western Libya. According to reports, four armed assailants disabled security cameras before entering his property in the Hammadah area south of Zintan and shooting him in the garden, then fleeing the scene. His cousin Hamid Gaddafi described him as 'martyred' on Libya Al Ahrar TV, while former Gaddafi spokesman Moussa Ibrahim condemned the killing as treacherous, noting a recent conversation where Saif expressed hopes for a united and sovereign Libya. Libya's Attorney General opened an investigation, with forensic confirmation of death by gunshot wounds, though perpetrators remain unidentified. The 444 Brigade, linked to Tripoli's government, denied involvement. Saif al-Islam, born in 1972, studied architecture and earned a PhD in Europe. He supported his father's regime during the 2011 NATO-backed uprising, faced an ICC arrest

item.title: The U.S. War Plan Red and Its Historical Context in U.S.–Canada Relations
item.description:
The article examines War Plan Red, a real military contingency plan developed by the United States between the late 1920s and mid-1930s, which outlined a hypothetical invasion of Canada in the event of a war with the British Empire. Designed in 1927, approved in 1930, and revised in 1935, the plan remained classified until 1974 and reflected interwar strategic thinking rather than an imminent intention to attack Canada. The plan assumed that the United States would quickly neutralize British forces and occupy key Canadian cities, including Halifax, Montreal, Toronto, and Ottawa, to prevent Britain from using Canada as a staging ground.
According to the article, the plan included detailed operational elements such as seizing ports, disrupting infrastructure, and rapidly occupying population centers. Considerable resources were devoted to preparedness, including military exercises near the Canadian border and the construction of airfields disguised as civilian airports. After public dis

item.title: Former Trump Supporter Explains Shift After Years of Research and Reflection
item.description: A former dedicated supporter of Donald Trump has publicly shared his reasons for changing his political stance, emphasizing that the decision came after extensive, long-term study rather than a sudden shift. The individual, who voted for Trump three times and actively campaigned during the first two elections, admitted to growing reservations by the third vote, particularly concerning the management of the COVID-19 pandemic and the January 6 events. Despite these concerns, he initially held hope that Trump could still effect positive change within flawed systems. He describes his evolution as resulting from thousands of hours of reading, research, and close observation of political and economic operations since around 2019. He strongly rejects accusations of developing 'Trump Derangement Syndrome' overnight, calling it mind-blowing and insisting his change stems from sustained attention and evidence-based analysis. The former supporter urges others not to take his word at face value bu

item.title: France Replaces US Videoconferencing Tools in Push for European Digital Sovereignty
item.description:
France has decided to phase out the use of U.S.-based videoconferencing platforms such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams within parts of its public administration, marking a significant step in Europe’s broader push for digital sovereignty. The move reflects growing concern among European governments about reliance on American technology firms for critical digital infrastructure, particularly in areas involving sensitive government communications and data protection.
French authorities are encouraging the adoption of European-developed alternatives that comply more closely with EU data protection rules, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Officials argue that even when U.S. companies store data on European servers, they may still be subject to American laws that allow U.S. authorities to access data, raising sovereignty and security concerns. By shifting to homegrown or Europe-based services, France aims to reduce strategic dependencies and strengthen control over publi

item.title: Comprehensive Guide to Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Program in 2026
item.description: Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards is a flexible loyalty program where points never expire and can be earned through paid flights (at 2x to 14x per dollar based on fare type like Basic, Choice, Choice Preferred, or Choice Extra), credit card spending, partner activities, and bonuses. Key features include highly flexible award flights with dynamic pricing tied to cash fares and demand, allowing cancellations or changes up to 10 minutes before departure with no fees and potential point refunds if fares drop. Elite status offers two tiers: A-List (20 flights or 35,000 tier points) provides priority boarding, 25% bonus points, free seat selection benefits, and one free checked bag; A-List Preferred (40 flights or 70,000 tier points) adds Group 1/2 boarding, 100% bonus, free Wi-Fi, premium drinks, and two free checked bags. Major 2025-2026 changes include no free checked bags for most passengers (except elites, credit card holders, or Choice Extra fares), expiring flight credits (12 or 6 mont

item.title: Crying Horse Plush Toy Becomes Symbol of Overwork Ahead of Chinese New Year
item.description: A red plush toy known as the 'crying horse' has unexpectedly become a viral sensation in China just before the Lunar New Year, marking the Year of the Horse. Originally intended to have a smiling expression, the toy ended up with a frown due to a manufacturing error, which has resonated with young workers who identify with its sad appearance. On Chinese social media platforms such as Sina Weibo and RedNote, the toy has become a symbol of the overworked and undervalued, reflecting widespread social fatigue under China's demanding '996' work culture, where employees often work from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m., six days a week. The phenomenon has sparked memes and posts relating the crying horse to everyday workplace frustrations. The small plush, priced under $5, has seen such high demand that the manufacturer added production lines and now ships internationally. Analysts suggest the toy's popularity reflects a deeper cultural response to the pressures faced by younger generations in high-stress wo

item.title: Loganair Offers 50% Discount on Award Flights for Avios Members
item.description: Loganair, the British airline that recently joined the Avios loyalty program, has launched a limited-time promotion offering 50% off award flights. Normally, a one-way Loganair award ticket costs 6,500 Avios, but during this sale, flights can be booked for only 3,250 Avios. To take advantage of this offer, bookings must be made by February 10, 2026, for travel starting March 7, 2026. Certain routes, including inter-Orkney flights, as well as interline and codeshare flights, are excluded from the promotion. This sale can provide significant value for travelers, especially on routes where cash fares are relatively high. For example, a flight from Aberdeen to Kirkwall in March can cost between £106 and £198 ($145-$271), meaning that redeeming only 3,250 Avios can offer 4.46 to 8.34 cents per point in value. Although Loganair is not a direct partner of any transferable points currency, members can transfer points from programs like British Airways Avios to book these discounted flights. Ov

item.title: Architecture That Responds to Light, Air, and Human Experience
item.description:
The article explores the concept of “breathing” as a contemporary architectural design philosophy that emphasizes responsiveness to light, air, movement, and the surrounding environment. Rather than treating buildings as sealed, static objects, breathing spaces are designed as dynamic frameworks that interact continuously with nature and human presence. From the moment one enters such a space, subtle elements—shifting daylight, gentle airflow, softened boundaries between indoors and outdoors—create a sense of calm and vitality.
Central to this approach is the rejection of over-containment. Designers prioritize orientation, openness, and the strategic use of natural light as a core material. Daylight is allowed to define rhythm and mood throughout the day, while shadows, reflections, and transparency are embraced instead of tightly controlled. Openings such as large glazed doors, sliding panels, and folding systems become active architectural elements, enabling cross-ventilation, visua

item.title: Diplomatic Talks Temporarily Delay U.S. Military Action Against Iran
item.description: Diplomatic efforts between the United States and Iran have led to a temporary postponement of any potential U.S. military strike on Iran. Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and U.S. Special Presidential Envoy Steve Witkoff are scheduled to discuss a possible nuclear agreement in Istanbul, with communications currently ongoing via text messages. Jared Kushner, along with senior officials from Turkey, Qatar, and Egypt, is also participating in the negotiations. Recently, U.S. President Trump announced the deployment of significant military forces to the region while expressing hope that Iran would agree to limit its nuclear program. Despite increased military presence, the threat of an immediate attack has decreased, as noted by the Wall Street Journal, which emphasizes protecting U.S. forces and regional allies. The key U.S. demands for any potential agreement include limiting uranium enrichment and restricting Iran's ballistic missile program, while Iran maintains its nuclear prog

item.title: Documents Reveal Social and Financial Ties Between Noam Chomsky and Jeffrey Epstein
item.description:
Recent disclosures from the US Justice Department have revealed extensive communications between Noam Chomsky and the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, providing further detail about their long-standing social and financial interactions. The newly released documents, part of the so-called Epstein files, suggest that Chomsky's relationship with Epstein extended beyond financial matters and included social invitations, vacation plans, and personal correspondence. Some emails show Chomsky and his wife Valeria engaging in friendly exchanges with Epstein and discussing meetings with prominent figures such as Steve Bannon and possibly Woody Allen.
Chomsky also provided advice to Epstein in 2019 regarding public criticism following court rulings about Epstein's past sex offenses. The communications highlight Chomsky's involvement in financial matters, such as discussions over payments and support for a linguistics challenge, where Epstein provided assistance. While there is no ev

item.title: Principles of Biophilic and Secure Design for Emotional Wellbeing in Spaces
item.description:
This article from Moss and Fog explores how intentional design in homes, workplaces, community areas, and outdoor spaces can foster feelings of protection and grounding, which are essential for emotional wellbeing, stress reduction, and mental clarity. Feeling protected goes beyond physical safety to include emotional reassurance through stable, predictable environments that allow the nervous system to relax, improving focus and decision-making. Key qualities include clear organization, visual balance, supportive boundaries, and comforting sensory elements like lighting, sound, and texture.
Grounding connects people to the present and their surroundings via natural materials (wood, stone, fabrics), nature-inspired colors, natural light, and outdoor views, reducing anxiety and enhancing belonging. Boundaries play a crucial role by defining spaces positively, signaling care and structure—especially outdoors, where professional fencing can blend security with aesthetics without feeling o

item.title: NASA Delays Artemis II Launch to March 2026 After Hydrogen Leaks in Wet Dress Rehearsal Test
item.description: NASA's Artemis II mission, the first crewed flight of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and Orion spacecraft aimed at sending four astronauts on a lunar flyby, has been delayed to at least March 2026 following issues during a critical Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) test conducted on February 2, 2026. The test, which simulates fueling and countdown procedures up to T-20 seconds, involved loading approximately 987 tons of cryogenic propellants into the SLS core stage (144 tons of liquid hydrogen and 840 tons of liquid oxygen) and additional propellant into the ICPS upper stage. Although the tanks were successfully filled for the first time in this campaign—a significant improvement over Artemis I—the test was halted multiple times due to persistent hydrogen leaks at the tail service mast umbilicals (TSMU), the same quick-disconnect interfaces at the base of the core stage that caused repeated delays in 2022. Leaks were detected when the hydrogen tank reached 55%, and despite efforts to war

item.title: Podcast Discusses Upcoming Transition of American Airlines Barclays Cards to Citi in April 2026
item.description: This Frequent Miler podcast episode, released on February 3, 2026, focuses on the major shift in American Airlines AAdvantage credit card issuance. Starting April 24, 2026, Barclays will no longer issue these cards, as Citi becomes the exclusive partner following an agreement to acquire Barclays' portfolio. Existing Barclays AAdvantage cardholders will automatically transition to comparable Citi-issued versions, receiving new cards with updated account numbers mailed within 6-8 weeks from April 27, 2026. Cardholders can continue using their current Barclays cards until the new ones are activated, with credit limits and anniversary dates preserved. The episode highlights key differences, such as companion certificate structures between Barclays and Citi offerings, and addresses concerns for specific tiers like $99 annual fee cards and the potential shift from Aviator Silver to the higher-fee Citi AAdvantage Globe card. It explores whether cardholders should cancel Barclays cards before

item.title: IHG Offers 15% Discount on Award Stays at Newly Opened Hotels
item.description: IHG is continuing its promotion that offers a 15% discount on award stays at newly opened hotels. This program has been active for several years and applies to different properties each month, covering stays up to three months in advance. The list of eligible hotels is updated monthly, and the latest round of discounted award stays is available through April 30, 2026. Bookings must be made by specific dates depending on the property: February 28, March 31, or April 30, 2026. While many of the new IHG properties, particularly in the United States, are budget-friendly brands such as Candlewood Suites and Garner, there are several interesting options worldwide. Notable new properties include voco hotels in Aruba, China, Italy, Thailand, and Dubai; Iberostar all-inclusive resorts in Mallorca; a Kimpton hotel in Kuala Lumpur; and a Crowne Plaza Resort in Petra, Jordan. Travelers interested in maximizing the value of IHG points may find these discounts worthwhile. Frequent Miler recommends c

item.title: Notepad++ Update Infrastructure Compromised by Suspected Chinese State-Sponsored Actors from June to December 2025
item.description: The official Notepad++ website was compromised at the hosting provider level, enabling attackers to intercept and selectively redirect update traffic for the popular text editor. The incident began in June 2025 and involved infrastructure compromise rather than flaws in Notepad++ code itself. Malicious actors redirected certain targeted users to attacker-controlled servers serving malicious update manifests, exploiting weaker update verification in older versions. Multiple independent security researchers attribute the attack to a Chinese state-sponsored group, citing the highly selective targeting typical of espionage campaigns. The shared hosting server was compromised until September 2, 2025, after which attackers retained internal service credentials until December 2, 2025, allowing continued redirection. The hosting provider conducted remediation, including credential rotation, vulnerability fixes, and server migrations, fully blocking attacker access by December 2, 2025. No concr

item.title: Capital One Shopping introduces new gift card redemption options including Marriott Bonvoy
item.description: Capital One Shopping has recently expanded its gift card redemption options, adding several popular merchants including Marriott Bonvoy, eBay, Walmart, Lowe's, Uber/Uber Eats, Petco, Holland America Cruise Lines, Groupon, Zappos, and more. These rewards are only available as gift cards, and the available options vary by user. The portal frequently updates its gift card offerings, with popular options appearing and disappearing without warning. The addition of Marriott Bonvoy is particularly beneficial for travelers, as these gift cards can be used globally at Marriott and Starwood properties, although users are advised to bring the cards to the front desk early to ensure smooth redemption. Other users have appreciated the return of gift cards for Petco, REI, and other general retailers. Fulfillment of gift cards may take between a few minutes to up to 72 hours. Frequent Miler recommends redeeming rewards promptly when desirable options appear, as the portal’s dynamic offerings may not

item.title: Joseph Ford and Nina Dodd Use Hand-Knitted Garments to Visually Merge People with Their Surroundings
item.description:
The photographic series Knitted Camouflage, created by photographer Joseph Ford in collaboration with knitter Nina Dodd, explores the relationship between people and the environments they inhabit through meticulously crafted hand-knitted garments. Rather than using digital manipulation, the project relies entirely on physical alignment, color, and pattern to create the illusion that people and even animals blend seamlessly into their surroundings. Each sweater is custom designed and knitted to precisely match a specific background, such as tiled walls, bus seat upholstery, running tracks, murals, or natural foliage.
Over several years of collaboration, Ford and Dodd have developed a process that combines careful observation with traditional craftsmanship. Dodd studies the chosen location and recreates its visual patterns stitch by stitch, while Ford frames the photograph so the garment aligns perfectly with the background. When the subject stands in position, the boundary between body

item.title: Frequent Miler Announces Next Ask Us Anything Live Session on February 4, 2026 at 9pm ET
item.description: Frequent Miler, a popular blog focused on maximizing credit card rewards, points, and miles for travel, has announced its monthly 'Ask Us Anything' live event. Hosted by the Frequent Miler team, including Stephen Pepper, the session is scheduled for Wednesday, February 4, 2026, at 9:00 PM Eastern Time on their YouTube channel. During these interactive streams, the team answers viewer-submitted questions about credit cards, transferable points programs like Amex Membership Rewards, Chase Ultimate Rewards, and Citi ThankYou, award bookings, airline and hotel loyalty strategies, manufactured spending, and other ways to earn and redeem miles efficiently. The post encourages viewers to subscribe to the Frequent Miler YouTube channel and enable notifications to stay updated on the live episodes. It also links to the most recent session recording and an archive of past episodes for those wanting to catch up. The blog provides extensive resources on topics such as best credit card offers, tran

item.title: How Data-Driven Micro-Targeting in Trump's 2016 Campaign Mirrored E-Commerce Strategies
item.description: The article explores the transformation of political campaigning through digital marketing, using Donald Trump's 2016 U.S. election victory as a prime example. It compares modern election strategies to online retail tactics, where voters are segmented into tiny demographic groups and targeted with personalized digital messages to influence behavior, including voting decisions. Unlike traditional methods relying on rallies, posters, or broad TV appeals, Trump's team, under Brad Parscale's 'Proyecto Álamo,' built extensive psychological profiles on 220 million Americans by integrating voter data, purchase histories, gun ownership records, and online activity from sources like Facebook, Experian, and Acxiom. This enabled the creation of over 100,000 unique ad pieces and nearly a billion text messages, with ads tailored to more than 4,000 traits per person based on psychometrics research linking Facebook 'likes' to personality via the OCEAN model. The campaign heavily invested in Facebook

item.title: Springfield church leader charged in federal case involving alleged child sexual exploitation
item.description:
Federal authorities have arrested and charged a Springfield, Illinois church official in connection with an alleged child sexual exploitation case, according to the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of Missouri. Michael Mohr, 54, who serves as president of the Central Illinois District of the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod, was taken into custody on Wednesday and formally charged with one count of producing child pornography.
Investigators say the case emerged after a juvenile reported a disturbing incident to Vandalia police. According to a sworn affidavit, the juvenile stated that they discovered a hidden camera concealed in a hotel bathroom. The report further alleged that Mohr stood over the juvenile and masturbated, prompting law enforcement to begin a broader investigation into his activities.
Search warrants were later executed at properties connected to Mohr in both Springfield and Vandalia. At Mohr’s Springfield residence, authorities reportedly recovered elect

item.title: Southwest Launches Flash Promotion: Earn Short-Term Companion Pass with One Round-Trip or Two One-Way Flights
item.description: Southwest Airlines has relaunched a limited-time promotion for Rapid Rewards members to earn a promotional Companion Pass with minimal effort. Members must register and then book one qualifying round-trip or two one-way flights between February 2 and February 5, 2026, for travel completed by March 31, 2026. Qualifying bookings include new reservations via Southwest's channels, with Rapid Rewards number added, covering revenue fares and award redemptions (including Cash + Points). Exclusions apply to charters, groups, and certain bookings. Upon flying the qualifying itinerary, participants receive a Companion Pass valid from August 10 to October 7, 2026, allowing a designated companion to fly free (paying only taxes/fees) on unlimited flights taken by the passholder during that window. This perk, normally requiring far more activity (100 flights or 135,000 qualifying points annually), offers great value for pairs traveling domestically. The article notes point bookings now qualify, easi

item.title: Alaska, American, and United Shopping Portals Offer 500 Bonus Miles/Points for Qualifying Spend in February 2026
item.description: As of February 3, 2026, Frequent Miler reports that three major airline shopping portals are running limited-time 'Winter Bonus' promotions, providing an additional 500 bonus miles or points for meeting modest spending thresholds. Alaska Airlines' Atmos Rewards Shopping portal offers 500 bonus points for cumulative qualifying purchases of $150 or more, with the promotion active from February 2, 2026, through February 11, 2026, at 11:59:59 pm ET. American Airlines' AAdvantage eShopping provides 500 bonus AAdvantage miles for spending $200, expiring February 9, 2025 (likely intended as 2026). United Airlines' MileagePlus Shopping matches with 500 bonus MileagePlus miles for $150 spend, also ending February 9, 2025 (likely 2026). These bonuses are added to standard earnings from shopping through the portals, which include both online purchases and in-store offers via card-linked programs where spend counts toward the thresholds. Key exclusions for qualifying purchases include returns, can

item.title: France’s Colonial Legacy and the Contradictions of Republican Universalism
item.description:
In this long-form opinion essay, Rafael Poch de Feliu examines the deep historical roots of European, and particularly French, complicity with contemporary colonial violence, using the case of Gaza as a moral and political point of departure. The article argues that France’s Third Republic (1870–1940), often celebrated as a milestone of democratic freedoms and civic rights, simultaneously consolidated a brutal and explicitly racist colonial system. While republican liberties, secular education, and parliamentary life flourished within metropolitan France, the empire was governed through coercion, legal discrimination, and permanent states of exception.
Poch details how colonial domination was codified through mechanisms such as the Code de l’Indigénat, which denied basic rights to colonized populations and institutionalized forced labor, collective punishment, and racial hierarchy. Prominent republican figures like Jules Ferry embodied this contradiction, defending universal education

item.title: EU Military Assistance Plans Risk Escalation as the War in Ukraine Deepens
item.description:
The article argues that the European Union is moving toward a dangerously escalatory path in its approach to the war in Ukraine. It focuses on proposals by Manfred Weber, leader of the European People’s Party, to strengthen and operationalize Article 42.7 of the EU Treaty, the mutual assistance clause that obliges member states to provide aid, including military support, in the event of an attack. According to the author, making this clause more concrete could significantly lower the threshold for EU involvement in armed conflict, especially if Ukraine joins the EU as planned in early 2027 while hostilities with Russia continue.
The text warns that such a move could rapidly draw the EU into war, not only through Ukraine but also through potential flashpoints in the Baltic states or other sensitive regions. It suggests that this may be an intentional strategy to use the assistance clause as a de facto European security guarantee for Eastern Europe, with some voices even proposing Ukrai

item.title: Human Rights Violations in the Imprisonment of María José Baños Andújar
item.description: The article denounces the systematic human rights violations suffered by political prisoner María José Baños Andújar in Spain. At 61 years old, she suffers from multiple serious and chronic health conditions, including advanced HIV, severe malnutrition, cardiovascular and liver problems, and respiratory disorders. Despite her critical health, Spanish prison authorities have denied her access to compassionate release and progression to less restrictive imprisonment, citing only her lack of ideological repentance, without considering medical or security risks. Legal experts from various countries argue that this practice violates the European Convention on Human Rights (CEDH), specifically Articles 2, 3, 8, 9, and 10, which protect the right to life, prohibition of inhuman treatment, private and family life, and freedom of thought and expression. The article references European Court of Human Rights cases, such as Kudla v. Poland and Mouisel v. France, confirming the state's obligation t

item.title: Why People Are Drawn to Simple Compatibility Percentages in Relationships
item.description: Compatibility percentages have become popular again in apps, quizzes, and horoscopes, providing a seemingly objective number that can ease the uncertainty of early romance. Romance often involves ambiguity, where people interpret signals inconsistently, leading to anxiety. A single percentage offers reassurance by simplifying complex factors like values, communication styles, emotional safety, life stages, and stress tolerance into one digestible figure. Psychologically, this appeal stems from biases: anchoring makes the initial score shape perceptions of friction; precision bias lends undue credibility to a neat number; and confirmation bias leads people to seek supporting evidence while ignoring contradictions. Most tools, such as name-based love calculators, rely on arbitrary algorithms inspired by numerology or astrology for entertainment rather than accurate measurement of relationship quality. While they vary in results due to different formulas, they can serve positive roles whe

item.title: Breeze Airways Offers 26% Discount on Round-Trip Base Fares with Promo Code WEEKDAY for Midweek Travel
item.description: Breeze Airways has launched a promotional offer providing a 26% discount on the base fare for round-trip flights when travelers use the promo code WEEKDAY during booking. This deal is available for new reservations made between February 3, 2026, and February 5, 2026, at 11:59 pm PT, through the airline's website or app. The discounted travel period runs from February 26, 2026, to September 15, 2026, but the promotion excludes flights on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, meaning it applies specifically to weekday travel to ensure the full discount. Key restrictions include that the discount applies solely to the base fare, not to taxes, fees, or additional charges like seat assignments or baggage, which can significantly reduce the overall savings on the total ticket price. The offer cannot be combined with other promotions, is not valid for group bookings, and any changes to reservations may result in fare repricing at current rates. Breeze Airways operates many unique nonstop routes no

item.title: Latvia Sentences Pro-Kremlin Activist Aleksandrs Gapoņenko to 10 Years in Prison for Inciting Hatred and Aiding Foreign State
item.description: On January 27, 2026, the Riga District Court in Latvia sentenced 72-year-old Aleksandrs Gapoņenko, a prominent pro-Kremlin activist, academic, and advocate for Russian-speaking minorities, to 10 years in prison followed by three years of probation. The conviction was for aiding a foreign state (identified as Russia) in activities directed against Latvia and for inciting national hatred and hostility. The charges stem from his 10-minute remote participation in a February 2025 online conference organized by the Moscow-based Institute of CIS Countries, titled 'The Ethnocide of Russian Compatriots in the Baltic States as a Factor in Preparing for War Against Russia.' In his speech, Gapoņenko discussed academic distinctions between genocide and ethnocide, defended Russia's diaspora support policies, highlighted alleged oppression of Russians in Latvia (including language restrictions and school closures), and reportedly suggested that a Russian invasion could halt such 'ethnocide,' along wi

item.title: Top Credit Card Welcome Bonuses and Offers in the US for February 2026
item.description: Frequent Miler's comprehensive guide for February 2026 lists the best publicly available welcome offers for nearly 300 U.S. credit cards from issuers like American Express, Chase, Citi, Capital One, and others. The page prioritizes unbiased, high-value promotions over affiliate-driven ones, displaying superior public deals even when they mean forgoing commissions. Offers are sorted by estimated first-year value, factoring in bonuses (points, miles, free nights, companion fares) and perks like travel credits, dining rebates, hotel benefits, and annual statements. Standouts include the Amex Platinum Card with up to 175K points and over $2,600 in first-year value from extensive credits (airline, Uber, Saks, Fine Hotels, entertainment, Lululemon, Resy); Chase Sapphire Reserve at 125K points with strong travel/dining perks valued around $1,544; Marriott Bonvoy Boundless with five 50K free nights; Amex Gold up to 100K points; and Citi Strata Elite at 100K points with hotel and luxury credits

item.title: New ICE Recruits Report Delayed Pay and Missing Benefits Amid Rapid Agency Expansion
item.description:
US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is facing growing internal criticism after employees turned to Reddit to describe ongoing problems with delayed pay, missing health insurance, and unfulfilled recruitment incentives. The complaints emerged following a major hiring drive that added roughly 12,000 new agents, intended to strengthen enforcement operations nationwide. Instead, many new recruits report that basic administrative systems have failed to keep pace with the rapid expansion.
Posts on the unofficial subreddit r/ICE_ERO describe officers waiting a month or more for their first paycheck and remaining uninsured weeks after starting work. Several employees said the absence of health coverage left them unable to afford medical care for their children. Others expressed frustration over signing bonuses that were heavily delayed, reduced by deductions, or not paid at all. While such issues are sometimes associated with routine onboarding delays, the scale and consistency of th

item.title: White House Clarifies Nicki Minaj’s Trump Gold Card Is a Souvenir, Not an Immigration Document
item.description: The White House has clarified that the gold-colored 'Trump Gold Card' shown by rapper Nicki Minaj on social media is purely a novelty item and holds no legal status regarding U.S. citizenship. Minaj, who has been a lawful permanent resident of the United States for around 20 years, previously suggested that the card could expedite her path to citizenship. However, a White House official stated that the card was symbolic and had no impact on her immigration status. Minaj shared the card following her participation in a White House event promoting children’s investment accounts under a Trump-backed initiative, where she was praised by President Trump for her financial contributions and support. Over recent years, Minaj has increasingly aligned herself with Trump and the MAGA movement, publicly describing herself as the president’s “No. 1 fan” and defending her support despite criticism from fans and civil rights groups. The White House emphasized that while the gold card has been widely

item.title: Rural Illinois Trump Voters Say Inflation and Trade Policies Continue to Strain Household and Farm Finances
item.description:
The article examines the growing frustration among rural Illinois residents who supported Donald Trump in the 2024 election but say their financial situations have not improved under his administration. Many factory workers, retirees, and farmers interviewed report that everyday costs such as groceries, utilities, and fuel remain high, undermining expectations that inflation would ease quickly after Trump returned to office.
Mark Baker, a retired factory worker living on Social Security in Waterman, Illinois, explains that limited local shopping options leave residents paying elevated prices for basic items like eggs, milk, and soda. He says incremental price increases make budgeting increasingly difficult, particularly for people on fixed incomes. Baker also expresses disappointment that Trump did not prioritize lowering costs immediately after taking office, which had been a central reason for his vote.
The article also highlights the impact of U.S. trade policy on farmers, especia

item.title: A Visual History of the Arctic and Its People in the Late 19th Century
item.description: This article explores the Arctic during the late 19th and early 20th centuries through historical photographs, focusing on both Indigenous life and European exploration. Indigenous communities such as the Inuit, Sámi, and Chukchi had long-established societies adapted to extreme conditions, relying on seasonal hunting, sleds, skin boats, and clothing made from furs and hides. Their knowledge of ice, weather, and wildlife was crucial for survival. Photographers like William Bradford documented these regions and people, producing rare images that capture daily life, whaling activities, icebound ships, and Arctic settlements. European interest in the Arctic evolved from Viking settlements to expeditions driven by trade routes and scientific curiosity. Notable explorers included Sir John Franklin, Fridtjof Nansen, Frederick Cook, Robert Peary, Richard E. Byrd, and Roald Amundsen. These expeditions combined ambition with growing scientific understanding of geography, oceanography, and ice d

item.title: Epstein Files Indicate Possible Connections to Russian Intelligence and High-Profile Figures
item.description: Newly released files from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation suggest that Epstein may have arranged multiple meetings with Russian President Vladimir Putin and had extensive connections with Russian intelligence, potentially acting on behalf of the KGB. The documents include over 1,000 references to Putin and thousands to Moscow, showing Epstein's interactions with Russian associates and his interest in bringing Russian women to meet prominent individuals. Emails reveal that Epstein discussed potential blackmail and offered intelligence insights to the Kremlin, including information regarding former US President Donald Trump. Epstein's connections may have been facilitated through business dealings with media magnate Robert Maxwell, who was allegedly a Russian asset. The files also detail Epstein's links to organized crime and high-profile figures, including Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Bill Gates, and US politicians. While US intelligence reportedly monitored these Russian ties closely,

item.title: Roy Wood Jr. Jokes About Low Attendance at Melania Trump Documentary Screening on CNN Show
item.description: Comedian Roy Wood Jr., hosting CNN's 'Have I Got News For You,' delivered a sharp roast of Melania Trump's self-titled documentary during a Sunday broadcast. The film, directed by Brett Ratner, follows the First Lady in the lead-up to Donald Trump's second inauguration and premiered with a high-profile event at the Kennedy Center. Despite mixed reviews and competition from films like 'Send Help' and 'Iron Lung' (which grossed $17.9 million), 'Melania' earned approximately $7 million domestically in its opening weekend, surpassing industry expectations of $2-5 million and marking the strongest non-concert documentary opening in over a decade. However, Wood Jr. highlighted its modest appeal by posing a mock trivia question: comparing ticket sales for a specific 3:40 pm showing at AMC's 34th Street Theater in New York City to the capacity of a Smart car. Panelists Michael Ian Black and Amber Ruffin joined in the humor, guessing even fewer attendees. Wood Jr. revealed 15 tickets sold for t

item.title: Roy Wood Jr. Mocks Low Attendance at Melania Trump's Documentary with Smart Car Joke on CNN Show
item.description: Comedian Roy Wood Jr., hosting or appearing on CNN's 'Have I Got News For You,' delivered a pointed joke targeting the theatrical attendance of Melania Trump's self-titled documentary, directed by Brett Ratner. In the bit, he posed a mock trivia question comparing the number of tickets sold for a specific Friday afternoon showing at an AMC theater in New York City to the passenger capacity of a Smart car. Panelists Michael Ian Black and Amber Ruffin joined in the humor, guessing even lower figures. Wood Jr. revealed that only 15 tickets were sold for the 3:40 pm showing, while a Smart car can hold up to 20 people, prompting big laughs from the audience. He emphasized the Smart car capacity as '100 percent accurate.' The joke highlighted perceptions of poor turnout despite the film's broader context. The documentary, which chronicles Melania Trump's life and role as First Lady during the transition back to the White House, premiered lavishly at the Kennedy Center. Melania described it a

item.title: Global Guinea Worm Cases Drop to 10 in 2025, Bringing Eradication Closer
item.description: The parasitic disease caused by the Guinea worm (Dracunculus medinensis) is nearing eradication, with only 10 human cases reported worldwide in 2025, according to the Carter Center. This marks a dramatic decline from 3.5 million cases across 21 countries when the eradication program began in 1986. The worm is transmitted through contaminated water containing copepods carrying larvae. Once ingested, the parasite migrates through the body and emerges painfully from the skin, typically in the legs or feet, potentially causing severe infections or disability. The remaining human cases in 2025 were reported in Chad, Ethiopia, and South Sudan. However, animal infections, particularly in dogs, continue to pose a challenge. Countries reporting animal cases include Chad, Mali, Cameroon, Angola, Ethiopia, and South Sudan. The eradication strategy includes public education on water safety and wound care, cash incentives for reporting cases, and larvicide treatment for water sources. Since 1986, t

item.title: Russia Exploits Starlink Technology to Extend Drone Attack Range
item.description: Since the start of the Ukraine war in February 2022, drones have become a critical component of the Russian military arsenal, enabling attacks on Ukrainian energy infrastructure while bypassing air defenses. Reports indicate that Russia has attempted to use Starlink satellite terminals on its drones, extending the range of BM-35 attack drones up to 500 kilometers, threatening the rear of Ukraine. Elon Musk announced that SpaceX has successfully prevented unauthorized use of the Starlink network by Russian forces. The Ukrainian military discovered several Russian drones equipped with Starlink, and the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) confirmed this exploitation. Ukraine promptly contacted SpaceX to address the issue, with CEO Gwynne Shotwell and Elon Musk personally responding. Starlink, consisting of thousands of low Earth orbit satellites, provides low-latency internet crucial for Ukrainian military communications. SpaceX does not sell or provide Starlink terminals to Russia, sugg

item.title: Barclays AAdvantage Aviator Cards Transition to Citi in April 2026: Benefits, Changes, and Uncertainties
item.description: Starting April 24, 2026, Barclays-issued American Airlines AAdvantage Aviator credit cards will transition to Citibank as the issuer, making Citi the exclusive provider of AAdvantage co-branded cards. Cardholders can continue using their existing Barclays cards after this date, with new Citi cards mailed within 6-8 weeks from April 27, 2026. Credit limits, anniversary dates, and initial annual fee assessments remain unchanged, though future fee changes are unclear. A key advantage is the temporary overlap of legacy Barclays benefits and new Citi perks, creating a 'best of both worlds' period until Citi provides advance notice of modifications. Specific transitions include: no-annual-fee Aviator White to Citi AAdvantage MileUp (adding 2X on AA purchases and groceries); Aviator Red ($99 fee) to Citi AAdvantage Platinum Select (adding 2X on gas and dining, with differing $20K spend rewards like a $125 flight discount versus companion certificate); Aviator Silver ($195 fee) to Citi AAdvant

item.title: Billie Eilish's Grammy Speech Sparks Debate About Her LA Home on Ancestral Land
item.description: After her politically charged acceptance speech at the 2026 Grammys, Billie Eilish is facing widespread online criticism for owning a Los Angeles mansion built on ancestral land of the Tongva tribe. During her speech for her song 'Wildflower,' Eilish addressed immigration enforcement and the history of colonization in the U.S., stating, 'no one is illegal on stolen land,' and condemned ICE operations. While her remarks received applause inside the venue, social media users highlighted the apparent contradiction of her advocating for migrant rights while living on land once owned by the Tongva people. Commentators suggested she should either return the property or open it to migrants. The Tongva tribe confirmed Eilish's mansion sits on their ancestral land but noted she has not reached out directly. They also expressed appreciation for her raising awareness about indigenous history and collaborated with the Recording Academy for the official Land Acknowledgment during Grammy week. The i

item.title: Active Points Transfer Bonuses to Airlines and Hotels in February 2026
item.description: This article from Frequent Miler details ongoing transfer bonuses for points from major flexible rewards programs to various airline and hotel loyalty partners in February 2026. Transfer bonuses allow users to receive extra miles or points when moving balances, often enabling higher value redemptions for flights or stays. Currently active promotions include a 15% bonus from Capital One Miles to Avianca LifeMiles (running from January 12 to February 11, 2026), a 30% bonus from Capital One Miles to Japan Airlines Mileage Bank (February 1 to 28, 2026), and a 50% bonus from Chase Ultimate Rewards to Marriott Bonvoy (February 1 to 28, 2026). item.title: Guide to Using Merchandise and Gift Card Buying Groups for Manufactured Credit Card Spending
item.description: This comprehensive guide explains how individuals can use buying groups to significantly boost credit card spending, primarily to meet minimum spend requirements for lucrative welcome bonuses, achieve elite status with airlines or hotels, or maximize rewards from category bonuses and everyday purchases. Buying groups pool purchasing power from many members to acquire large quantities of discounted merchandise or gift cards—items often restricted by per-person limits—then resell them, allowing sellers to offload products to the group after purchase. The process typically involves signing up with a group, monitoring deals via email, Telegram, WhatsApp or similar channels, committing to buy specific items, purchasing with credit cards (often drop-shipped to tax-exempt warehouses), providing tracking, waiting for receipt confirmation (usually 3-5 days), and receiving payment via ACH after a short float period of 2-3 weeks.
