item.description: This article provides a comprehensive overview of current hotel promotions as of February 2026, focusing on loyalty programs and incentives for travelers. Major hotel chains, including Marriott, IHG, Hyatt, Choice, Hilton, Preferred Hotels, and Best Western, offer a variety of promotions designed to encourage bookings, reward elite status, and increase loyalty program engagement. Offers range from bonus points per stay, double points after multiple stays, extra elite nights, gift cards, and discounts at specific properties. Many promotions require registration prior to the first qualifying stay, and some are targeted to specific members, making it important for travelers to check eligibility before booking. The article also includes a detailed list of expired promotions, allowing readers to track historical offers and identify patterns in loyalty program incentives. Overall, the piece serves as a practical guide for travelers looking to maximize rewards and benefits from hotel stays, p

item.title: Chase Ultimate Rewards Offers 50% Bonus on Transfers to Marriott Bonvoy Points in February 2026
item.description: From February 1 through February 28, 2026, Chase Ultimate Rewards is offering a 50% bonus when transferring points to Marriott Bonvoy. Normally, 1,000 Chase points convert to 1,000 Marriott points, but during this promotion, they convert to 1,500 points. While this can increase the number of Marriott points you receive, the overall value may not be optimal for every user. Frequent Miler estimates Chase points are worth approximately 1.5 cents each, and Marriott points about 0.76 cents each. With the bonus, the effective value is around 1.14 cents per Chase point, which is lower than redeeming directly through Chase Travel with the right card. This transfer bonus is most valuable when you have a specific high-value Marriott redemption in mind. Marriott allows a “stay 5, pay 4” benefit for all members, and it’s possible to find award nights where the point value exceeds 1 cent per point, making select redemptions worthwhile. Award stays don’t earn points unless a promotion is active, and

item.title: Melio Review: Paying Business Bills by Credit Card, Fees, Eligibility, and $200 Welcome Bonus
item.description:
The article provides a detailed overview of Melio, a U.S.-based payment platform designed to help businesses pay bills more flexibly, including by credit card. Melio allows business owners to pay vendors via ACH transfers for free (with limits depending on the plan) or by credit or debit card for a 2.9% fee. This option is particularly attractive for businesses seeking to earn credit card rewards, meet large welcome offer spending requirements, or take advantage of big-spend bonuses such as free hotel nights or elite status.
Melio supports a wide range of business expenses, including rent (when paid to a business), utilities, taxes, SaaS subscriptions, professional services, contractors, inventory, and certain loan or mortgage payments when funded by bank transfer. Personal payments and several regulated or high-risk industries are explicitly prohibited. The platform offers a free plan, Melio Go, which includes unlimited card payments at the standard 2.9% fee, while paid plans add fea

item.title: Lawsuits Allege Church Leaders Ignored Youth Pastor’s Sexual Abuse of Children
item.description: Two lawsuits filed in Washtenaw County Circuit Court allege that Oakwood Baptist Church leadership, including Pastor Frank Radcliff and members of his family, were aware of sexual abuse committed by youth pastor Zachary Radcliff years before it became publicly known. Zachary Radcliff, 30, is accused of abusing 11 children and faces 60 criminal charges, including 17 counts of first-degree criminal sexual conduct, with the possibility of life imprisonment. The lawsuits claim the church fostered a culture of silence, prioritizing loyalty to the institution over accountability and the safety of its members. Allegations suggest that inappropriate behavior by Zachary Radcliff began when he was a teenager, and some victims were coerced into sending explicit videos in exchange for money. Church leaders reportedly misrepresented Zachary’s actions and location to authorities while allowing him access to church funds for grooming purposes. The lawsuits seek damages for negligence, vicarious liabi

item.title: Atmos Rewards Ascent Visa Signature launches 85,000-point welcome bonus with companion fare
item.description:
The Atmos™ Rewards Ascent Visa Signature® Card has introduced an increased welcome offer that significantly enhances its appeal to travelers who collect airline miles. New cardholders can earn 85,000 Atmos Rewards points plus a companion fare after spending $4,500 within the first 90 days. With a modest $95 annual fee, this promotion positions the card as a strong option for those seeking high-value travel rewards at a relatively low upfront cost.
The bonus alone can be enough for premium travel redemptions, particularly given the strong redemption sweet spots within the Atmos program. For example, travelers based in the northeastern United States may find one-way business class awards to Europe starting at 45,000 points, making it possible to nearly cover a round-trip business class ticket shortly after meeting the minimum spending requirement. Factoring in the points earned from qualifying purchases, cardholders could accumulate close to 90,000 points quickly.

item.title: Capital One Shopping Offers Up to 50% Cashback on Viator Bookings Today
item.description: On February 2, 2026, Capital One Shopping is offering a limited-time, widely targeted promotion for bookings on Viator, providing 45% to 50% cashback on purchases up to $1,000. The offer appears differently for users depending on their account and browsing, so it is recommended to check the full list of home page offers for the best rate. Capital One Shopping does not require a Capital One account to participate, and users can also earn additional bonuses through referral links. While Viator provides convenient access to activities and transfers, the article warns about inconsistent customer service, including last-minute cancellations and difficulty resolving issues directly with Viator. Previous users reported both positive experiences with airport transfers and occasional frustrations with activity cancellations. Capital One Shopping rewards from Viator can only be redeemed for gift cards, though the selection has improved. The promotion provides a significant opportunity for travel

item.title: Daughter of LA Mayoral Candidate Austin Beutner Dies at 22 After Being Found in Medical Distress on Roadside
item.description: Emily Beutner, the 22-year-old daughter of Los Angeles mayoral candidate Austin Beutner, tragically passed away on January 6, 2026. A witness reported seeing a woman in visible distress near the intersection of Sierra Highway and Technology Drive in Palmdale shortly after midnight, prompting a call to authorities. Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department deputies and paramedics responded, providing treatment at the scene before transporting her to a nearby hospital, where she was later pronounced dead. Initially described as a medical emergency, the case was transferred to the LASD homicide unit, which is standard protocol for unexpected deaths of young people under unusual or unclear circumstances, rather than an immediate indication of foul play. As of early February 2026, the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner’s Office had not released an official cause of death, and the investigation continued. Austin Beutner, who shares four adult children with his wife Virginia, issued a brief st

item.title: Artist Darren Cullen Completes Map of US Military and CIA Interventions Since 1900
item.description: Artist Darren Cullen has completed a detailed illustrative map titled 'US Empire,' which visually charts US military and CIA foreign interventions from 1900 onward, along with locations of US military bases and CIA torture black sites. The map draws inspiration from an 1886 British Empire map and relies heavily on sources such as William Blum's book 'Killing Hope' (with a recommendation for Vincent Bevins' 'The Jakarta Method'). Cullen provides a spreadsheet with sources and links for further research on each intervention, embedded on the page. He notes that many additional actions—such as CIA assassinations outside coups, US-backed death squad massacres, sanctions, threats, and political pressures—were excluded to allow completion of the project. In his commentary, Cullen critiques the popular narrative of American exceptionalism and freedom taught in the 1980s and 1990s, describing post-colonial US power as an anti-democratic, authoritarian force responsible for tens of millions of d

item.title: Pro-Trump Brazilian Influencer Detained by ICE Over Missed Immigration Court Hearing
item.description:
U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement arrested Junior Pena, a Brazilian social media influencer with nearly half a million Instagram followers, in New Jersey after he missed a court hearing related to his immigration status. Pena, who immigrated to the United States in 2009, is well known online for openly identifying as an immigrant and sharing stories about people seeking better lives in the U.S. At the same time, he has been a vocal supporter of President Donald Trump and has publicly defended the administration’s hard-line immigration policies.
The arrest came amid heightened immigration enforcement during the early days of Trump’s renewed immigration crackdown. Following reports that Brazilians were among those detained or deported during the administration’s first week, Pena addressed his followers in Portuguese, urging them not to panic. He argued that enforcement actions were targeting criminals rather than immigrants broadly, warning his audience not to trust what he descr

item.title: US Lawsuit Questions WhatsApp's End-to-End Encryption Claims
item.description: A new class-action lawsuit has been filed in the U.S. Northern District of California alleging that WhatsApp’s claims of end-to-end encryption (E2EE) are misleading. The complaint, filed on January 23, 2026, suggests that Meta employees can access the contents of WhatsApp messages through an internal system, despite repeated public assurances that only senders and recipients can read messages. The lawsuit cites whistleblower statements claiming that message access can be requested internally and, once approved, viewed in near real time or historically without additional decryption steps. Meta has strongly denied these allegations, stating that WhatsApp has used end-to-end encryption with the Signal protocol for a decade and calling the lawsuit “frivolous.” Importantly, the complaint does not present technical evidence proving any compromise of encryption or a cryptographic backdoor. Past reporting confirms that WhatsApp can access messages reported for abuse and collects extensive meta

item.title: Essential Wardrobe and Packing Tips for a Lake House or Cabin Retreat
item.description: Planning a getaway to a lake house or cabin requires thoughtful packing that balances comfort, practicality, and style. The key is selecting versatile pieces that are suitable for outdoor activities, lounging indoors, and casual social gatherings. Layering is crucial due to fluctuating temperatures, starting with breathable base layers like cotton t-shirts or henleys, followed by mid-layers such as flannel shirts or lightweight sweaters, and finishing with outer layers like quilted vests, field jackets, or wool coats. Essential wardrobe items include high-quality sweaters in natural fibers like cashmere or merino wool, versatile trousers such as dark denim, chinos, or corduroys, and practical yet stylish footwear including leather boots, duck boots, or loafers. Outfits should be adapted for specific activities: relaxed yet polished looks for lounging, functional attire for hiking, and slightly elevated ensembles for dining out. Accessories like a classic watch, a wool or cashmere scarf

item.title: Unverified Allegations Against Former US Ambassador Earl Anthony Wayne Surface in Epstein Document Releases
item.description: Recently released documents from the Jeffrey Epstein case, totaling nearly 3 million pages from the U.S. Department of Justice, include unverified claims by an individual named Kenneth Darrell Turner linking retired U.S. diplomat Earl Anthony Wayne to child sex trafficking networks associated with Epstein. Turner alleges in specific files that Wayne impregnated an 11-year-old girl in Mexico, with DNA evidence purportedly confirming paternity at 100%, leading to a 2017 life imprisonment sentence in Mexico. According to Turner, Wayne evaded the sentence through a payoff arrangement involving the U.S. State Department and a Mexican judge, allowing a former U.S. Marine to serve the time instead, and that an outstanding arrest warrant remains in Mexico. Additional claims involve Wayne's alleged presence during a 2014 Mexican Federal Police raid on the U.S. Embassy in Mexico, Epstein's visits to the embassy, and related materials found with former Navy SEAL Richard Marcinko. Turner reportedl

item.title: Turkish Artist Aydın Büyüktaş Creates Surreal Landscapes with Distorted Perspectives
item.description: Turkish artist Aydın Büyüktaş has gained attention for his innovative approach to landscape photography, transforming familiar scenes into surreal, gravity-defying compositions. By using a bent perspective technique, Büyüktaş makes ordinary landscapes appear as if the land itself folds upwards into the sky, creating a dreamlike yet convincing visual effect. The images challenge viewers' perception of reality, offering a unique blend of surrealism and realism that resonates with contemporary audiences. His work draws inspiration from other visual designers and photographers, yet maintains a distinct style characterized by meticulous attention to detail and composition. Büyüktaş shares his creations on social media platforms, particularly Instagram, allowing a wide audience to experience his imaginative reinterpretation of natural environments. His landscapes evoke a sense of wonder and curiosity, highlighting the potential of photography to push beyond conventional visual boundaries whi

item.title: European Payment Leaders Agree on Interoperable Framework for Cross-Border Payments by 2027
item.description:
Leading European payment providers Bancomat, Bizum, SIBS-MB WAY, Vipps MobilePay and EPI Company have signed a Memorandum of Understanding aimed at strengthening Europe’s payment sovereignty and enabling seamless cross-border payments across the continent. The agreement brings together major national and pan-European payment solutions under a shared vision of reducing Europe’s dependence on non-European payment providers while offering consumers and merchants a competitive, homegrown alternative.
The cooperation builds on the existing success of domestic payment systems by connecting them through a central interoperability hub. This hub, to be operated by a jointly established entity, will act as a technical layer allowing transactions to flow seamlessly between national and European solutions, while preserving each solution’s brand, user experience and features. The initiative is grounded in European standards and infrastructures, including instant account-to-account payments.
At la

item.title: Forest Mixer Installation Transforms Human Voice into Vibrations Felt by Nature
item.description: Forest Mixer is an innovative acoustic ecology installation created by Montreal-based studio Daily tous les jours, located on Hornby Island, British Columbia. The project allows participants to interact with a forest environment by speaking or singing into sculptural 'whispering dishes,' which convert their voices into low-frequency vibrations. These vibrations travel through a wooden platform and into the soil, enabling people to experience sound as a physical and ecological phenomenon. Rather than imposing human presence on nature, Forest Mixer integrates humans into the forest's soundscape, highlighting the relationship between humans and the environment. This installation emphasizes the subtle, often unnoticed rhythms of the forest, allowing participants to perceive nature not just visually or audibly, but also physically. It represents a unique approach to ecological awareness, combining art, technology, and environmental engagement, and encourages visitors to consider their voice

item.title: Portuguese center-right politicians endorse left-wing candidate to block far-right leader
item.description: In an unprecedented move, Portugal’s leading center-right politicians have publicly endorsed António José Seguro, a former Socialist Party secretary general, in the upcoming presidential runoff on February 8. This decision is aimed at preventing the far-right Chega party leader, André Ventura, from winning the presidency. Ventura, who secured nearly a quarter of votes in January's first round, has risen rapidly by campaigning against minority groups, criticizing immigration, and denouncing government corruption. Prominent figures supporting Seguro include former President Aníbal Cavaco Silva, ex-Deputy Prime Minister Paulo Portas, and Lisbon Mayor Carlos Moedas. Thousands of non-socialist public figures have also signed an open letter backing Seguro, emphasizing a defense of democratic values over party loyalty. While current polls suggest Ventura’s chances of winning are slim, conservatives argue their support for Seguro signals a clear boundary between liberal democratic forces and r

item.title: Travel and Airline News Highlights: Hotel Bathroom Design, Airport Security Incidents, Heathrow Liquid Rules, and JetBlue Promotion Costs
item.description:
This Saturday Selection article from Frequent Miler curates several travel- and aviation-related stories that caught the editors’ attention during the week, even if they did not warrant full standalone coverage. The first topic focuses on a growing controversy in hotel design: bathrooms without proper doors. Many modern hotels have adopted glass walls or open bathroom layouts that compromise privacy, prompting frustration among travelers. The article highlights a grassroots response to this trend through a website called “BringBackDoors.com,” which publicly tracks hotels based on whether they offer adequate bathroom privacy. The author views this trend as impractical and applauds travelers for pushing back against it.
The second story addresses a serious airport security incident at Detroit Metro Airport, where a man drove a Mercedes through the entrance of the McNamara Terminal and into a ticketing area. While the motive remains unclear, the event has raised concerns about insufficie

item.title: The Environmental Impact of Non-Biodegradable Wet Wipes
item.description: The article discusses the environmental hazards caused by non-biodegradable wet wipes, highlighting recent legislation in the United Kingdom that bans their sale. These wipes, often mistaken for toilet paper, are made from plastic fibers that do not decompose naturally. When flushed down toilets or discarded outdoors, they persist in the environment for decades, contributing to microplastic pollution in soil, rivers, and oceans. The author emphasizes the impracticality of proper disposal in everyday life, as people are unlikely to carry used wipes to a trash bin. The piece calls for other countries to follow the UK's lead in regulating these products, framing the issue as both an ecological concern and a reflection of societal carelessness. The article blends humor and frustration to stress the long-term consequences of ignoring this seemingly minor but pervasive problem.

item.title: From Carolingian Script to Fraktur: The Cultural and Political History of Blackletter Type
item.description:
The article traces the long and complex history of blackletter typefaces, often misleadingly called “Gothic,” from their medieval origins to their association with German nationalism and Nazism. It begins with Carolingian minuscule, a highly legible script developed in the late 8th century under Charlemagne as part of a broader cultural revival aimed at unifying Christian scholarship across Europe. This script became the ancestor of both modern Roman typefaces and later medieval handwriting styles.
As Europe fragmented after Charlemagne’s empire collapsed, regional styles evolved. In northern France and England, highly angular and dense scripts emerged, mirroring the ornate Gothic architecture of the High Middle Ages. These styles, though unrelated to the ancient Goths, were later labeled “Gothic” by Renaissance humanists in Italy, who viewed them as barbaric deviations from classical Roman ideals. Italian scholars revived and idealized Carolingian scripts, calling them “Antiqua,” and

item.title: Comprehensive Guide to US Credit Cards for Expats and Frequent International Travelers
item.description: This article provides a detailed guide on the best US credit cards for expats and international travelers. It highlights the most rewarding options for overseas spending, covering categories such as general international purchases, groceries, dining, gas, and everyday expenses. For a single versatile card, the Atmos™ Rewards Summit Visa Infinite® Card stands out, offering 3x points on foreign transactions, dining, and select airlines, with no foreign transaction fees and numerous travel perks. The Citi Strata Premier℠ Card is also recommended for those seeking a lower annual fee and strong rewards on groceries, dining, gas, and travel bookings. Other notable cards include the Bilt Obsidian Card and Aeroplan® Card for groceries, the American Express® Gold Card, Chase Sapphire Reserve®, and Citi Strata Elite℠ Card for dining worldwide, and various cards such as the Costco Anywhere Visa and USAA Cashback Rewards Plus for gas purchases overseas. The article also warns readers about cards w

item.title: Farmers' Tractor Protests Against Trade Agreement in Galicia
item.description: The article discusses the ongoing tractor protests on the A-52 highway in Galicia, Spain, highlighting the perceived unequal treatment of protest groups by authorities depending on political alignment. It compares these farmer protests with historical demonstrations, such as bishops opposing same-sex marriage, which did not face police suppression. The author criticizes how rural agricultural sectors, heavily subsidized and politically influential, can block major highways for days, disrupting public life, while other groups protesting for social or political causes would face swift repression. The protests are in response to a free trade agreement with Mercosur, which will open European markets to more competition. While European industry is expected to benefit from increased exports, some agricultural sectors, particularly beef farmers, fear losing profits. The article emphasizes that certain sectors, like dairy, pork, and olive oil, will remain competitive or even benefit. The autho

item.title: Democrat Taylor Rehmet Secures Texas Senate Seat in Fort Worth District
item.description: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate, taking a seat in a district that had strongly favored former President Donald Trump in 2024. Rehmet, a labor union leader and military veteran, defeated Republican Leigh Wambsganss by over 14 points in the Fort Worth-area district, flipping a traditionally Republican seat. The vacancy occurred after four-term Republican Kelly Hancock resigned to assume another statewide office. National figures reacted to the election results, with the Democratic National Committee framing the win as a warning to Republicans, while former President Trump had publicly supported Wambsganss. Rehmet’s campaign received backing from the DNC and veterans’ group VoteVets, which spent approximately $500,000 on advertising. Although Rehmet now holds the seat, she will serve only until early January and must win the November general election to secure a full term. The Texas Legislature is not expected to reconvene until 2027, and Republica

item.title: Criticism arises over DHS proposal linking affordable housing to reporting undocumented immigrants
item.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) sparked controversy with a recent social media post promoting a scheme that tied affordable housing opportunities to reporting undocumented immigrants. The DHS X post encouraged residents to report illegal aliens by calling a dedicated hotline, while providing a link for undocumented individuals to manage their departure. Experts and political commentators reacted strongly, calling the initiative reminiscent of authoritarian practices. Immigration specialist Aaron Reichlin-Melnick described the post as encouraging citizens to report neighbors to gain housing, while journalist Aaron Rupar called it 'straight up Gestapo.' Other commentators, including political candidates and activists, compared the initiative to Nazi-era and Soviet-style informant systems. Senator Scott Wiener criticized the plan as a method to 'collapse the workforce' under the guise of housing affordability. Former ambassador Steven Pifer noted historical parallels with t

item.title: Years Without Trial: Systemic Delays and Long-Term Pretrial Detention in San Francisco Jails
item.description:
The article investigates how San Francisco’s criminal justice system keeps dozens of people in jail for years without a trial, despite constitutional and state-law guarantees of a speedy trial. Focusing on people labeled “long stayers,” the piece highlights that at least 96 individuals have been held in county jail for three years or more without a verdict, and some for nearly a decade or longer. Through detailed reporting and interviews, the story centers on cases such as Vincent Bell and Montrail Brackens, arrested in 2012 and still awaiting trial more than thirteen years later, as well as Marquez Harrison and LaCarla Carr, jailed since 2014 without a trial date.
The article explains how delays are driven by a combination of factors: overburdened public defenders and court-appointed attorneys, a shortage of judges and courtrooms, repeated continuances granted to prosecutors, and institutional dysfunction within San Francisco Superior Court. Although California law promises felony de

item.title: Fela Kuti Receives Posthumous Grammy Honor for Pioneering Afrobeat
item.description: The Recording Academy has posthumously awarded a Grammy to Nigerian musician Fela Kuti, recognizing his unparalleled career and contributions to African music. Fela, who passed away in 1997, was a trailblazer in creating the Afrobeat genre, blending African rhythms with jazz, funk, and socially conscious lyrics. Known for using his music as a form of protest against political oppression and social injustice in Nigeria and across Africa, Fela's work left a lasting international legacy. His Afrobeat compositions feature extended arrangements, brass sections, and repetitive percussion, influencing musicians globally across jazz, hip-hop, and funk. Notably, this Grammy is an honorary lifetime achievement award, making Fela the first African artist to receive such recognition, distinguishing him from African artists who have won competitive Grammy awards. Fela's life was deeply intertwined with activism, including associations with the Black Panthers during a U.S. tour, establishing the ind

item.title: Antifa groups identify and expose ICE agents involved in abusive practices
item.description: A network of antifascist activists, traditionally focused on exposing neo-Nazis and far-right extremists, has shifted attention to U.S. immigration enforcement agencies, particularly ICE and CBP. In Minneapolis, activists from the Pacific Antifascist Research Collective identified a border patrol agent who pepper-sprayed a detained protester, distributing flyers with his name and labeling him a 'suspected kidnapper/terrorist.' The collective, along with other antifascist groups, aims to hold agents accountable for what they consider abusive and violent actions during immigration operations. Activists emphasize that anonymity allows agents to continue harming communities without social consequences. This modern strategy of 'doxing' follows a long American tradition of exposing those who commit violence in secrecy, dating back to anti-lynching campaigns and anti-Klan espionage. While support for ICE has declined nationally, with polls showing increasing opposition to agents wearing masks

item.title: Five-year-old boy and father released from ICE custody following court order
item.description: A five-year-old boy, Liam Conejo Ramos, and his father, Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias, returned to their home in Minneapolis after being detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) in Texas since January 20. Their release followed a federal judge’s order condemning the administration’s mass deportation efforts as harmful and poorly executed. Images shared by Democratic Rep. Joaquin Castro showed Liam wearing a blue cap and Spider-Man backpack, echoing a viral photo taken during his father’s arrest at their Minneapolis home. The family’s detention drew widespread criticism, with lawmakers and neighbors accusing federal officers of traumatizing children and using tactics such as instructing Liam to knock on the door to lure his mother. Court documents cited Bible verses alongside Liam’s image and criticized the administration’s disregard for human and historical principles. Several Minnesota politicians, including Senators Amy Klobuchar and Representative Ilhan Omar, welco

item.title: Capital One Offers 30% Bonus When Transferring Miles to Japan Airlines Mileage Bank
item.description: Capital One is currently offering a 30% transfer bonus for its cardholders who move their miles to Japan Airlines Mileage Bank (JMB), valid through February 28, 2026. Normally, Capital One miles do not transfer 1:1 to JMB, but with this bonus, 1,000 Capital One miles convert to 975 JMB miles, nearly achieving parity. This promotion is particularly attractive for frequent flyers seeking valuable award bookings. Japan Airlines Mileage Bank allows members to book flights on Japan Airlines, Air France, Emirates, and other carriers, often without excessive surcharges. Additionally, Bilt points transfer 1:1 to JMB, which can be combined with Capital One miles for greater flexibility. However, there are some restrictions: only self and family member redemptions are allowed, and new JMB accounts must wait at least seven days before redeeming miles. The bonus is especially useful for those with seasoned accounts ready to redeem miles for premium travel options. Frequent Miler recommends ensurin

item.description:
The article reports that Staples is once again offering a promotion on $200 fixed-value Mastercard gift cards with no activation fee. The deal is valid for in-store purchases only and runs from Sunday, February 1, 2026, through Saturday, February 7, 2026. According to the weekly ad, customers are limited to purchasing up to nine gift cards per person per day, although anecdotal reports suggest that some stores may allow higher quantities while others may enforce stricter limits at a manager’s discretion.
This type of promotion is particularly appealing to consumers who use credit cards that earn bonus rewards at office supply stores, such as certain small business or cash-back cards. By purchasing up to nine $200 cards in a single day, a customer could generate as much as $1,800 in qualifying spend without paying activation fees, effectively earning points, miles, or cash back at a lower cost. For those who are able to repeat purchases over multiple days, the rewards potential can be

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Lewis Hamilton Reportedly Spend a Private Weekend Together in the UK
item.description:
Recent reports have fueled speculation about a possible romantic relationship between Kim Kardashian and Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton after the two were said to have spent a private weekend together in the United Kingdom. According to a report cited by The Sun, Kardashian traveled from Los Angeles to England on Saturday via her private jet specifically to meet Hamilton. Sources quoted in the report described the weekend as highly discreet and romantic. item.description: Cardi B and NFL player Stefon Diggs have experienced a complicated relationship since becoming a couple in 2025. According to recent reports, Cardi B has established strict boundaries with Diggs, emphasizing that loyalty and transparency are non-negotiable. This comes after Diggs became a father to four children with four different women within the past year, including a son with Cardi B. Sources reveal that Cardi has clearly communicated that if Diggs were to cheat or have a child without her knowledge, she would end the relationship. Despite these challenges, Cardi reportedly entered the relationship fully aware of Diggs’ reputation and past relationships, trusting him to be faithful since they became official. The couple is said to be focusing on creating a stable family environment, discussing parenting strategies, and maintaining respectful relationships with Diggs’ other children and their mothers. Cardi is committed to making the relationship work, but the message is clear: any

item.title: Bad Bunny Uses Grammy Acceptance Speech to Call for Compassion on Immigration
item.description:
Bad Bunny made headlines at the Grammy Awards not only for winning Best Música Urbana Album, but also for using his acceptance speech to address immigration, identity, and social division in the United States. The Puerto Rican artist paused before offering traditional thank-yous to deliver a pointed message that criticized U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and called for empathy toward immigrant communities.
Standing before an audience of industry peers, Bad Bunny opened his remarks by declaring 'ICE out,' a statement that immediately drew a strong reaction from the crowd. He then challenged dehumanizing rhetoric often directed at immigrants, emphasizing that they are not criminals or outsiders but human beings who are part of American society. Speaking deliberately, he underscored themes of dignity and belonging, framing immigration as a human issue rather than a political talking point.
The artist also reflected on the emotional toll of polarized political climates, ac

item.title: Iran, China, and Russia Establish Trilateral Strategic Framework for Cooperation
item.description: On January 29, 2026, Iran, China, and Russia officially signed a comprehensive strategic pact, marking a significant development in 21st-century international relations. While the full text of the agreement is being released gradually, the three governments have described it as a cornerstone of a new international order. The pact builds upon previous bilateral agreements: Iran and Russia's 20-year Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, and Iran and China's 25-year Cooperation Agreement aimed at trade, infrastructure, and energy integration. The new trilateral framework aligns the three countries on issues such as nuclear sovereignty, economic cooperation, military coordination, and diplomatic strategy. Importantly, it does not constitute a binding mutual defense treaty like NATO’s Article 5, but it signals a political coalition united against unilateral military and economic pressures from the West. The agreement strengthens Iran's position in the Middle East, providing strategic leverag

item.title: Vivian Wilson Reflects on Childhood Caribbean Travels Amid Release of Epstein-Related Emails Involving Elon Musk
item.description: Freshly released documents linked to Jeffrey Epstein have brought renewed attention to Elon Musk's past interactions with Epstein, highlighting attempts by Musk to visit Epstein’s private island in the Caribbean. The documents, obtained from the US Department of Justice, include email exchanges from 2012 and 2013 where Musk coordinated possible visits with Epstein. Despite multiple plans, including discussions around holiday travel and parties, none of the visits appear to have occurred due to scheduling or logistical conflicts. In response to the circulating emails, Musk’s estranged daughter, Vivian Wilson, shared a memory of childhood trips in the region, recalling boat rides between St. Vincent and St. Barth’s during holiday seasons and the dark night sea she remembered. Vivian, around nine years old during the time of these emails, has publicly distanced herself from Musk, legally changing her name in 2022. The records do not confirm that Musk ever actually went to Epstein’s Little

item.title: France Releases Seized Russian Tanker Following Legal Concerns
item.description: On January 22, 2026, France intercepted the Russian oil tanker 'Grinch' in the Mediterranean with assistance from British intelligence. The operation, widely publicized as part of Russia's so-called 'ghost fleet,' faced immediate legal scrutiny. Under French law, the seizure was considered illegal, forcing authorities to release the vessel. French President Macron acknowledged in a conversation with Ukrainian President Zelensky that the current legal framework was insufficient and indicated plans to amend domestic legislation to allow future actions against Russian tankers to comply with the law. The tanker had departed from Murmansk, Russia, and although initially claimed to be without a flag, it was actually registered under the Comoros flag. Images circulated by the French Navy depicted assault troops on the bridge, inspecting the ship's papers, resembling routine traffic enforcement procedures. While the initial seizure received extensive media attention, the release occurred discr

item.title: Lily Allen Considers Releasing Previously Shelved Album Addressing Personal Trauma in Music Industry
item.description: Lily Allen, the British singer-songwriter, may be preparing to release an unreleased album that deals with deeply personal experiences of abuse and bullying within the music industry. The project, reportedly created five years ago, was initially shelved by her former label BMG due to a dip in her popularity at the time. According to sources cited by Daily Mail, the album reflects a difficult period in Allen's life, including alleged sexual abuse by a powerful music executive and harassment by other industry figures. With the success of her recent album 'West End Girl,' which focused on themes of infidelity and heartbreak, Allen's public profile and influence have grown significantly. This shift could allow her more control over the release of previously withheld material. While Allen has not publicly named the individuals involved, fans and industry observers are already discussing the potential impact of the album, particularly in the context of increasing attention to accountability

item.title: Analysis of Alleged Death Toll and Propaganda Surrounding Iranian Protests
item.description: The article discusses claims made by various NGOs and media outlets regarding the number of deaths during protests in Iran. It highlights that figures vary widely, ranging from as low as 3,117 deaths reported by Iranian authorities to exaggerated claims of up to 80,000 deaths circulating on social media and opposition outlets. The piece emphasizes that many of these organizations, including the ICHR, HRAI, and UANI, are linked to foreign governments or interests, particularly the United States and Israel, suggesting that the dissemination of inflated figures serves geopolitical and ideological purposes. Examples include unverified stories of protesters hiding in body bags and reports spread by networks of bots. The article positions these narratives as part of a historical pattern, drawing parallels with past propaganda campaigns used to justify military interventions, such as in Iraq, Libya, and Syria. It argues that these tactics are employed to delegitimize Iran internally and inter

item.title: Analysis: Why Hezbollah Is Likely to Join a Potential War Involving Iran Against US and Israeli Threats
item.description: The article argues that Hezbollah, Iran's most powerful proxy and strategic ally, will fully engage in any direct conflict targeting Iran, particularly from the United States, rather than remaining on the sidelines as it did during the Twelve-Day War in June 2025 between Iran, the US, and Israel. It describes Hezbollah as an integral extension of Iran's military apparatus, bound by ideological loyalty under the Wilayat al-Faqih doctrine and structural command integration with the IRGC. The group is portrayed as a versatile 'queen' on the regional chessboard, capable of unleashing a massive rocket arsenal to strike northern Israel, opening a multi-front war and serving as Tehran's forward defense. Quotes from figures like former US Defense Secretary Leon Panetta emphasize Hezbollah as Tehran's most potent retaliatory force, while Israeli analyst Yaakov Amidror notes its automatic activation when Iran is threatened. The piece stresses that participation is not mere solidarity but essenti

item.title: South Africa and Israel Expel Each Other's Top Diplomats Amid Rising Tensions
item.description: South Africa has declared Ariel Seidman, Israel's top diplomatic representative in Pretoria, persona non grata, giving him 72 hours to leave the country. The decision stems from repeated breaches of diplomatic protocol, including public statements from Israel's mission insulting South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and failure to notify authorities of visits by senior Israeli officials. This marks a significant escalation in tensions between Pretoria and Tel Aviv, which already have strained relations following South Africa's 2023 complaint against Israel at the International Court of Justice over alleged acts of genocide in Gaza. Israel responded in kind by declaring Shaun Edward Byneveldt, South Africa's top diplomat in Israel, persona non grata with the same 72-hour deadline. The dispute underscores the deep diplomatic rift over issues including the treatment of Palestinians and the legacy of apartheid-era solidarity, with traditional diplomatic channels between the two nations e

item.title: Cresta: A Sustainable Bench Capturing the Colors of Sardinia’s Coast
item.description: Designer Andrea Ponti has created 'Cresta,' a sculptural bench that captures the essence of Sardinia's coastal waters. The bench transitions in color from deep marine blues to almost transparent tones, mimicking the effect of sunlight on water. Its design gives the impression of fluid motion, resembling a frozen wave, while remaining fully functional as seating for two people. What sets Cresta apart is its sustainable construction: it is crafted from recycled plastics, including acrylic, PET, and polycarbonate, transforming waste materials into a tactile and visually striking piece of furniture. The vertical textures on the bench scatter light, changing its appearance throughout the day, and occasionally glowing, making it as much a piece of art as a practical object. Cresta demonstrates that eco-friendly design can be bold and aesthetically pleasing, rather than subtle or understated. The piece highlights innovative approaches to sustainability in contemporary design, blending artistr

item.title: Paris Hilton Says She and Britney Spears Have Discussed a Possible Music Collaboration
item.description:
Paris Hilton has sparked excitement among pop music fans after revealing that she and longtime friend Britney Spears have discussed the possibility of working together on new music. In a recent interview with Attitude magazine, Hilton shared that the two have been talking about recording together and have revisited the idea during recent meetups. While she stopped short of confirming anything concrete, Hilton expressed genuine enthusiasm, describing a collaboration with Spears as a dream scenario and calling it something that would be 'the most iconic thing ever.'
The conversations come at a time when Hilton is actively immersed in music again. She is currently developing her third studio album, following her self-titled debut released in 2006 and her 2024 comeback album, Infinite Icon. Her renewed focus on music has made the idea of a collaboration with Spears feel more plausible, even if it remains in the early stages.
Hilton also used the interview to praise Spears’ artistic legac

item.title: Elon Musk denies visiting Jeffrey Epstein’s island amid renewed scrutiny of released emails
item.description:
Elon Musk has publicly responded to renewed scrutiny following the release of U.S. Department of Justice documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, which include email exchanges between the billionaire entrepreneur and the convicted sex offender. Writing on X, Musk said that his emails had been “misinterpreted” and insisted that he never visited Epstein’s private island in the Caribbean nor traveled on his private aircraft. According to Musk, he repeatedly declined invitations to do so, despite maintaining limited correspondence with Epstein years after Epstein’s 2008 conviction for sex crimes involving minors.
The newly released documents contain emails from 2012 and 2013 in which Musk appeared to discuss potential visits to the Caribbean and asked Epstein about parties or suitable dates to meet. Some messages referenced helicopters, travel logistics, and the possibility of visiting Epstein’s island. While the emails suggest a friendly tone, it remains unclear whether any visit ever took

item.title: U.S. Justice Department Releases Extensive Epstein Files, Revealing High-Level Contacts and Unverified Allegations
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Justice has released what it describes as the largest disclosure to date of documents related to convicted financier Jeffrey Epstein, comprising millions of pages, images, and videos. According to Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche, the release concludes a lengthy review process intended to balance transparency with the protection of ongoing investigations and victims’ identities. The files offer insight into Epstein’s activities during his incarceration and his communications with numerous prominent individuals.
Among the materials are emails and records referencing Epstein’s interactions with political leaders, business figures, and members of European royalty. Reports highlighted by BBC Mundo note exchanges allegedly involving Prince Andrew, Donald Trump, Elon Musk, and Bill Gates, though all named individuals have denied wrongdoing or stated that references to them have been misinterpreted. Several of the allegations contained in the documents remain unver

item.title: Trump Accuses Former President Obama of Misconduct Related to the 2016 Election
item.description:
The article reports that President Donald Trump publicly accused former President Barack Obama of attempting to undermine the 2016 U.S. presidential election and called for his arrest. According to the piece, Trump made the accusation in a post on his Truth Social account, claiming that Obama and his associates were involved in what he described as a “coup” against his presidency. Trump asserted that newly released documents related to the long-running investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election support his claims.
The article states that Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard allegedly released a large number of documents connected to the so-called “Russiagate” controversy. Trump is quoted as saying these materials prove that Obama personally ordered intelligence agencies to fabricate information intended to damage Trump and weaken public trust in the electoral process. The article reproduces Trump’s language, which includes accusations of treason and collab

item.title: Economist Peter Schiff warns of potential U.S. dollar and debt risks amid rising gold prices
item.description:
The article reports on warnings from economist Peter Schiff, chief economist at Euro Pacific Asset Management, who argues that rising gold and silver prices signal deep structural problems in the U.S. economy. Speaking on Fox Business, Schiff claims that accelerating inflation, growing federal debt, and declining global confidence in the U.S. dollar could lead to a severe financial crisis, potentially worse than the 2008 recession. He suggests that central banks around the world are reducing their holdings of U.S. dollars and Treasury bonds while increasing gold reserves, which he interprets as preparation for a dollar and sovereign debt crisis.
Schiff criticizes the current economic indicators cited by the Trump administration and its supporters, arguing that official data on growth, inflation, and productivity are distorted by inflation and are likely to be revised downward. He contends that the U.S. economy is overly dependent on consumer credit and the dollar’s status as the world

item.title: Elon Musk's previously undisclosed ties to Jeffrey Epstein revealed in newly released emails
item.description: Newly released emails from the Department of Justice reveal that Elon Musk had a closer relationship with Jeffrey Epstein than previously known. These communications, dating back to 2012 and 2013, show Musk and Epstein discussing plans for Musk to visit Epstein’s private island, Little St. James. Though Musk did not ultimately visit the island due to scheduling conflicts, the exchanges depict a more cordial and friendly rapport between the two men than Musk has publicly admitted. Musk has long denied any substantial connection to Epstein, previously calling the financier a 'creep' and rejecting claims that Epstein tried to involve him in activities at his island. The documents also include a series of emails where Epstein invited Musk to various events, including offering the use of his helicopter to visit the island, as well as correspondence about a potential lunch at SpaceX. These revelations raise further questions about Musk's ties to Epstein and the broader network of individuals

item.title: Tutorial: Using Seats.aero to Search for Award Flight Availability (Video Guide)
item.description: This Frequent Miler article, published on January 31, 2026, by Caroline Yoder, introduces a video tutorial demonstrating how to use Seats.aero, a specialized search tool popular among points and miles enthusiasts. Seats.aero enables users to scan award flight availability across multiple airline loyalty programs over extended periods, such as a full year in its Pro version, making it ideal for identifying 'sweet spot' redemptions where points offer high value. The video walks through practical examples of finding premium cabin awards. Key segments include locating Virgin Atlantic Premium Economy options starting at 01:10, explaining that search results are cached for speed but can be refreshed by clicking the information 'i' icon (at 06:48), discovering American Airlines business class flights bookable with Alaska miles (08:11), accessing Etihad first class using American Airlines miles (10:24), finding Qatar Airways business class with JetBlue TrueBlue points (13:07), and using JetBlu

item.title: Earn 25% Cash Back on StubHub via TopCashback and Chase Credits
item.description: Frequent Miler reports a notable opportunity for Chase Sapphire Reserve® cardholders who haven’t yet used their $150 StubHub credit. Through the TopCashback (TCB) portal, shoppers can receive 25% cash back on StubHub purchases, with a maximum cashback of $100. TopCashback is recognized as a reliable portal for both tracking purchases and issuing payouts, making this a straightforward way to maximize value. This deal can be combined with the existing $150 Chase credit for StubHub, enhancing overall savings. Previously, elevated rewards for StubHub were available through other portals, such as 40% back via Capital One Shopping, but those were restricted to gift card usage. The current offer represents one of the largest true cash-back opportunities for StubHub in recent months. Shoppers are encouraged to check platforms like Cashback Monitor to compare potential rewards before completing their purchases. The article also provides guidance for those interested in maximizing miles and poin

item.title: Unverified Epstein Emails Allege Misconduct Involving Bill Gates and Melinda Gates
item.description: Newly released emails from Jeffrey Epstein, included in a large tranche of documents by the U.S. Department of Justice, allege that Bill Gates contracted a sexually transmitted disease from 'Russian girls' and requested antibiotics to secretly administer to his then-wife Melinda Gates. The emails, dated July 18, 2013, were reportedly drafts intended to be sent by Gates' top advisor, Boris Nikolic, around the time of his resignation from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Epstein's messages criticize Gates for ending their friendship and describe morally questionable requests. Gates has long denied any wrongdoing and has stated he regrets knowing Epstein. The documents also contain photographs of Gates with Epstein and others, including one where a woman's face is redacted. Melinda Gates, who divorced Bill in 2021 after 17 years of marriage, cited his alleged affairs and friendship with Epstein as factors in their split. Previous reports confirm Gates met Epstein on multiple occasio

item.title: Emails in Epstein Files Show Elon Musk Inquired About Visiting Little St. James in 2013
item.description: On January 30, 2026, the U.S. Department of Justice released over 3 million pages of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein as part of ongoing disclosures mandated by law. Among them are email exchanges from December 2013 involving Elon Musk, Epstein, and Epstein's longtime assistant Lesley Groff. The correspondence indicates Musk, while in the Virgin Islands area, asked Epstein about a suitable time to visit Little St. James island between January 1-8, 2014. Epstein responded positively, stating 'any day 1st - 8th... always space for you.' A follow-up redacted email referenced organizing Musk's arrival for January 2. Additional earlier emails mentioned Musk potentially attending an April 2013 dinner. Similar references appear for Musk's brother Kimbal seeking a meeting with Epstein in 2012. These details emerged years after Epstein's 2008 conviction for sex-related charges under a controversial plea deal. The article highlights that Musk has repeatedly denied visiting the island, tellin

item.title: Interstate 19 in Arizona: The Only U.S. Highway Marked in Kilometers
item.description: Interstate 19 in Arizona is a unique exception in the United States, being the only highway entirely marked in kilometers rather than miles. While the U.S. largely relies on the Imperial system for measurements, efforts to adopt the metric system have been made over the years. The Metric Conversion Act of 1975, signed under President Jimmy Carter, aimed to make the metric system the preferred standard for commerce and public works. As part of this initiative, the highway from Tucson to Nogales was built with kilometer-based signage and exit numbering. However, nationwide conversion efforts failed, mainly due to high costs and cultural attachment to the Imperial system. By 1982, President Ronald Reagan officially ended the metric conversion campaign, leaving Interstate 19 as a rare legacy. Local attempts to switch the highway to miles have been unsuccessful, and Arizona maintains parallel mile-based signs for operational purposes, invisible to drivers. Despite occasional political discu

item.title: Ecuadorian Immigrant Witness to Fatal Shooting of Alex Pretti by Border Patrol Agents Speaks Out While in Hiding
item.description: Jose Huerta Chuma, a 41-year-old Ecuadorian immigrant who has lived in the U.S. for over two decades, gave his first public interview to CBS News about witnessing the fatal shooting of Minneapolis resident Alex Pretti on January 24, 2026. Huerta Chuma, who was the target of a Border Patrol operation that day, described being followed by agents while driving for rideshare work, fleeing on foot, and hiding in a local business for about four hours. From inside, he saw Pretti arrive, film the agents, and get tackled after agents pushed a woman nearby. He stated that Pretti did not appear to reach for or use his firearm, yet agents fired multiple shots after disarming him. Huerta Chuma expressed deep guilt and distress over Pretti's death, describing him as a good person and questioning why he was killed. DHS initially labeled Huerta Chuma a 'violent criminal illegal alien' and claimed Pretti intended to massacre agents, but his record shows only misdemeanors (including a 2018 disorderly co

item.title: Escalation of Russian Attacks Disrupts Ukraine’s Railway Infrastructure and Civil Logistics
item.description:
The article reports a recent intensification of Russian attacks targeting Ukraine’s railway network, a critical component of the country’s civilian and economic infrastructure. According to Ukrainian authorities, multiple railway assets were struck within a 24-hour period, including active trains, tracks, electrical substations, and technical buildings. In the Kharkiv region, a train was reportedly hit by drones, illustrating the increasing vulnerability of rail transport to aerial attacks. The Ukrainian government emphasizes that these incidents are not isolated but form part of a deliberate campaign aimed at undermining a system essential to daily life and economic stability.
Prime Minister Yuliya Svyrydenko condemned the strikes, describing them as intentional attacks on civilian logistics. Railways in Ukraine play a vital role in passenger transport, the delivery of essential goods such as food and medical supplies, and the evacuation of civilians from threatened areas. Since the

item.title: UK Car Production Falls to Post-War Lows Amid Tariffs and Cyberattack
item.description:
The British automotive industry experienced one of its most difficult years in recent history, with vehicle production falling to levels not seen since 1952, excluding the extraordinary lockdown periods during the COVID-19 pandemic. In total, only around 764,000 vehicles rolled off production lines last year, representing a sharp decline of 15.5% compared with the previous year. This downturn highlights the structural vulnerabilities of the sector and the impact of external shocks on the UK’s industrial base.
Two main factors explain the contraction. The first was the imposition of tariffs by the United States on British-made vehicles. Although these tariffs were eventually reduced from an initial 27.5% to 10%, the bilateral agreement between Washington and London only applies to a quota of 100,000 vehicles per year. This limitation significantly constrained exports and reduced the competitiveness of UK carmakers in one of their key markets.
The second major blow came from a cyberatt

item.title: Bruce Springsteen Joins Tom Morello at Minneapolis Benefit Concert for Families of ICE Shooting Victims
item.description: On January 30, 2026, Bruce Springsteen made a surprise appearance as the 'very special guest' at a sold-out benefit concert organized by Tom Morello at the iconic First Avenue venue in Minneapolis. The event, titled 'A Concert of Solidarity & Resistance to Defend Minnesota!', was announced just two days earlier and aimed to raise funds for the families of Renee Good and Alex Pretti, two 37-year-old individuals killed in separate incidents by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Customs and Border Protection agents earlier that month—Good on January 7 and Pretti on January 24. Morello, known for his activism with Rage Against the Machine, headlined alongside Rise Against, singer/songwriter Ike Reilly, and guitarist Al Di Meola. Springsteen, who had released his new protest song 'Streets of Minneapolis' shortly before the event as a direct response to these killings, performed it live for the first time, sharing that he consulted Morello on its tone, receiving encouragement

item.title: Russia Calls for Broader Investigation Into Nord Stream 2 Explosion
item.description:
Russian authorities have rejected claims that Ukrainians alone were responsible for the explosion that damaged the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline, insisting that such conclusions are premature and politically motivated. Speaking at a press briefing in Moscow, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova emphasized that Russia does not accept a narrative that assigns sole responsibility to Ukrainian actors. Instead, she stressed the need for a comprehensive, impartial, and transparent investigation that examines all possible parties involved in the incident.
Zakharova stated that Moscow has consistently called for full disclosure of investigative findings related to the Nord Stream explosions and has criticized what it views as selective leaks and speculative reporting in some Western media. According to her, attempts to narrow responsibility to one group undermine the credibility of the investigation and raise questions about whether all relevant evidence is being considered. She

item.title: Two Die After Woman Is Pushed Onto Subway Tracks at Hamburg Station
item.description:
An 18-year-old woman and a 25-year-old man died on Thursday evening after a fatal incident at the Wandsbek Markt subway station in Hamburg, Germany. According to police and local media reports, the young woman was waiting on the platform at around 10:07 p.m. when the man, identified as a Sudanese national, suddenly grabbed her and dragged her onto the tracks as a train was approaching. Both individuals were struck by the train and died at the scene.
Witnesses told investigators that the man had been walking along the platform prior to the incident and appeared to be intoxicated. One eyewitness reported hearing him say, 'I'll take you with me,' moments before he pulled the woman onto the tracks without warning. Authorities have stated that there is currently no evidence suggesting that the two knew each other prior to the incident.
The initial response was handled by Hamburg’s criminal investigation unit LKA 26, but due to the suspicion of homicide, the case was transferred to the LKA

item.title: Chase changes how Ink Business Cash® 5x spending is displayed without altering the annual limit
item.description:
The Chase Ink Business Cash® credit card has long been popular among small business owners and points enthusiasts because it offers 5x Chase Ultimate Rewards points on up to $25,000 in annual purchases at office supply stores and on select telecommunications services. Historically, cardholders could easily track their progress toward this cap because Chase displayed rewards activity based on the cardmember year, resetting the tracker at each card anniversary.
According to Frequent Miler, Chase has recently changed how this information is shown in its online account interface and mobile app. Instead of tracking bonus earnings from the cardmember anniversary date, the rewards tracker now displays spending as if it were tied to the calendar year, for example showing activity 'since January 2026.' This visual change has caused confusion among many cardholders, leading some to believe that the $25,000 limit for earning 5x points may now be based on the calendar year.
However, the underlyi

item.title: Details About the Points Travel Festival in Toronto on April 18, 2026
item.description: Frequent Miler contributors Nick Reyes and Greg Davis-Kean will be speaking at the Points Travel Festival in Toronto on April 18, 2026. The one-day event, running from 9 AM to 5 PM at the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto Airport, includes sessions on maximizing travel rewards, earning and redeeming points, booking award flights, and other points-and-miles strategies. Tickets for the full-day event are priced at CAD $279 (~$205 USD) until January 31, after which they increase to CAD $299. An optional Friday evening party at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel is available for CAD $99 (~$73 USD), including drinks and appetizers. The event features multiple speakers from the travel rewards community, including Patrick Sojka, Reed Sutton, Josh Bandura, and contributors from Prince of Travel, Flytrippers, Maple Miles, and more. While many topics will focus on Canadian reward programs like Aeroplan stopovers and Avios multi-carrier awards, the content is expected to be relevant to attendees from the US as w

item.title: African regional court annuls sanctions against Mali on procedural and jurisdictional grounds
item.description:
The article reports on a ruling by a West African regional court declaring illegal the sanctions imposed on Mali in early 2022 by the West African Economic and Monetary Union (UEMOA), acting in coordination with the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). These sanctions, described as unprecedented in severity, included border closures, the freezing of Malian state assets held at the Central Bank of West African States, and the suspension of commercial and financial transactions. Mali’s transitional government immediately denounced the measures as inhumane and unlawful.
Three years later, the court based in Ouagadougou issued a judgment overturning the sanctions that had been adopted during an extraordinary summit in Accra, Ghana. The judges accepted Mali’s argument that the decision-making process was procedurally flawed, as the UEMOA treaty requires such summits of heads of state and government to be held within the territory of a member state. Holding the meeting outsid

item.title: Bilt Extends Transition Deadline to February 1, 2026, and Confirms Rent Day Double Points Through January 2027 for 2.0 Cards
item.description: Bilt Rewards has announced an extension for existing cardholders to transition seamlessly to the new Bilt 2.0 credit cards, now allowing choices until February 1, 2026, instead of an earlier cutoff. This change gives current users more time to select one of the new cards without needing a full new application process later. Additionally, the company has confirmed that the Rent Day double points promotion for non-housing purchases will persist through January 1, 2027, benefiting both newly issued and transitioning Bilt 2.0 cardholders. On the first of each month (Rent Day), users earn double points on eligible non-rent spending, capped at 1,000 bonus points per month. This runs from 12:00am ET to 11:59pm PT. Note that Bilt Cash and points from housing payments are excluded from doubling. For the new Bilt 2.0 lineup starting in March 2026, effective earning rates on Rent Day include: Blue Card at 2x on everyday purchases; Obsidian Card at 6x on dining or groceries (user choice), 4x on tr

item.title: US Holds Meetings with Alberta Separatist Leaders Amid Tensions with Canada
item.description: According to reports by the Financial Times, the United States government has held secret meetings three times since April last year with leaders of Alberta's separatist movement, 'Prosper Alberta.' Alberta, a Canadian province rich in oil, has seen growing calls for independence. Jeff Rath, the legal advisor for 'Prosper Alberta,' claimed that the US supports Alberta's independence and described its ties with former President Trump as stronger than those with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney. Labor Federation president Gilles McGowan criticized the movement's use of social media campaigns, chatbots, and MAGA influencers, calling it foreign interference. Separatist leaders are reportedly seeking a $500 billion credit from the US Treasury to fund Alberta if a referendum on independence is approved, though no official referendum date has been set. White House officials acknowledged meetings with civil society organizations but stated that no commitments have been made. Treasury source

item.title: AltiHut: A High-Altitude Mountain Refuge That Blends Brutalism with Warmth
item.description:
Located high in the mountains near Stepantsminda at an elevation of over 3,000 meters, AltiHut is a compact architectural refuge that rethinks what a mountain cabin can be. Designed by the studio STIPFOLD, the project explores how high-altitude hospitality can be both minimal and welcoming without imposing itself on an extreme landscape. Rather than relying on dramatic gestures, the design emphasizes restraint, functionality, and harmony with its surroundings.
The structure is conceived as a small shelter for limited groups, featuring a simple internal layout and a lofted sleeping area oriented toward the expansive mountain views. Its defining exterior element is a continuous fiber-concrete shell, sculpted to resemble a natural boulder. This form allows the building to visually recede into the terrain, reinforcing the idea that architecture should serve as a quiet frame for nature rather than a focal point competing with it.
Inside, the atmosphere shifts subtly from rugged to warm. N

item.title: Celebrating Catherine O’Hara’s Life and Career in Comedy
item.description: Catherine O’Hara, who passed away at 71 after a brief illness, was a uniquely talented actress whose career spanned nearly fifty years. Known for her ability to balance absurdity with humanity, she brought unforgettable energy to every role. From the frantic mother in Home Alone to the eccentric Moira Rose in Schitt’s Creek, O’Hara had a rare gift for making audiences feel both laughter and empathy simultaneously. Her work on SCTV helped shape modern comedy, while her performances in Beetlejuice and other films turned unusual characters into memorable, relatable figures. Beyond her impeccable timing and skill, what truly set O’Hara apart was her warmth. Even her most over-the-top roles carried a softness and honesty that resonated with viewers. Her characters were never merely jokes—they were amplified versions of real people, drawing audiences into their world. O’Hara leaves behind a husband, children, and a legacy of performances that continue to inspire and entertain new generations

item.title: Why Trump’s Second-Term Governing Style Fits the Historical Definition of Fascism
item.description:
In this opinion essay, Jonathan Rauch argues that President Donald Trump’s second-term governing style should now be described as fascist, a label he previously resisted using. Rauch explains that fascism is often poorly defined and overused, but insists that recent developments have made the comparison unavoidable. While Trump’s first term could largely be understood as patrimonialism—treating the state as a personal possession—the author contends that the administration has since evolved toward a more coherent and aggressive ideology consistent with fascism.
Rauch identifies fascism not as a single policy or act, but as a constellation of traits that become clear when viewed together. These include the deliberate demolition of civic norms, glorification of violence, and the embrace of a “might makes right” worldview. He highlights Trump’s rhetoric praising brutality, his administration’s public celebration of force, and the transformation of ICE into a powerful national paramilitary

item.title: Beachman ’64 Street Spec Blends Classic Café Racer Design with Modern Electric Power
item.description:
The Beachman ’64 Street Spec is an electric motorcycle that intentionally looks backward to move forward. Designed by Canadian brand Beachman, the model draws heavy inspiration from 1960s British café racers, combining nostalgic aesthetics with contemporary electric engineering. Its low-profile silhouette, bubble-style windscreen, slim tires, and exposed frame evoke the romance of vintage European motorcycling, while carefully integrating modern components in a way that feels refined rather than technical.
At the heart of the Street Spec is a removable lithium battery, offered in two configurations: a 2.8 kWh pack providing up to 55 miles of range, and an optional 3.6 kWh version extending range to around 70 miles. Both options support regenerative braking and feature built-in charging ports. Charging to 80 percent takes roughly three hours using a standard charger, or about half that time with an optional fast charger, making the bike practical for daily urban use.
One of the most n

item.title: Strategies for Maximizing Credit Card Rewards and Bonuses
item.description: This article summarizes a podcast episode where the hosts discuss practical strategies for increasing credit card spending to earn larger rewards and bonuses. They outline a variety of methods used in real life, including paying taxes via credit card, using services like Plastiq and Melio to pay bills that normally do not accept credit cards, funding college savings accounts, making loans through Kiva, and even buying and selling merchandise or gift cards to meet spending thresholds. The episode also touches on charitable giving, cruise ship expenditures, and funding new bank accounts as ways to generate additional spend. The hosts provide detailed guidance and links to resources for each method, emphasizing responsible and strategic use of credit to maximize rewards without incurring unnecessary fees. Additionally, the episode covers updates on credit card offers, such as changes to Bilt card exclusions, and tips on managing card accounts, including when to downgrade or cancel cards t

item.title: Hyatt Integrates Bahia Principe Resorts into Its All-Inclusive Award Program Starting March 2026
item.description:
World of Hyatt is expanding its all-inclusive portfolio with the addition of Bahia Principe Hotels & Resorts, which will officially join Hyatt’s Inclusive Collection on March 24, 2026. This move follows a strategic joint venture announced at the end of 2024 between Hyatt and Grupo Piñero, the parent company of Bahia Principe. With this integration, 22 Bahia Principe properties across the Caribbean and Spain will become bookable and earnable within the World of Hyatt loyalty program, making Bahia Principe the 38th distinct brand under Hyatt.
Unlike some recent Hyatt additions that rely on dynamic pricing, Bahia Principe resorts will follow Hyatt’s established all-inclusive award chart. Free night awards will start at 12,000 World of Hyatt points during off-peak periods, potentially offering more affordable redemption options in a segment that has become increasingly expensive. Members will earn 5 base points per eligible U.S. dollar spent on room rates, receive credit toward elite stat

item.title: Global Economies Shift Focus Away from U.S. Trade Policies
item.description: Paul Krugman discusses the growing economic separation between the United States and other major global economies. He highlights the recent free trade agreement between India and the European Union as a historic and concrete deal that contrasts sharply with the vague and mostly unfulfilled trade promises made by the Trump administration. Krugman argues that both the EU and India are pursuing stronger economic ties with each other in part to reduce dependence on the United States, which he describes as an erratic and unreliable trade partner under Trump. He notes that U.S. tariffs, especially on Indian exports, and aggressive political and economic actions by the Trump administration have pushed these countries to seek alternative partners. The article emphasizes that access to the U.S. market is less critical to other nations than access to major economies like the EU, suggesting that global trade patterns are shifting. Krugman concludes that this economic distancing will have tangible

item.title: Economic struggles in rural America create political challenges for Republicans
item.description: Former Republican strategist Rick Wilson highlights the growing economic crisis among American farmers and its political implications ahead of the 2026 midterm elections. Wilson notes that rural communities, which overwhelmingly supported Donald Trump in 2024, are now facing severe financial hardships. Major crops such as corn, soybeans, and cotton are experiencing dramatic losses, with net farm income projected to drop by $41 billion this year, one of the steepest declines in decades. Tariffs imposed during the Trump administration have severely impacted U.S. exports, particularly to China, while strict immigration policies have further strained the agricultural labor force, leaving many fields unharvested. Wilson emphasizes that these economic consequences are now becoming a political liability for Republicans, who remain associated with policies that are financially harming their most loyal supporters. The article portrays this situation as a stark example of how policy decisions ca

item.title: Russia plans a nuclear fission reactor to power the Sino-Russian lunar research station
item.description:
The article analyzes Russia’s planned contribution to the International Lunar Research Station (ILRS), a joint Chinese–Russian robotic lunar base intended to be deployed near the Moon’s south pole. While China will mainly rely on solar energy for the station, Russia proposes to add a nuclear fission reactor to significantly increase available power and expand scientific capabilities. Despite political tensions following Russia’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine and the resulting budgetary and credibility issues affecting Roscosmos, nuclear space technology remains an area where Russia retains notable expertise.
To implement this contribution, Roscosmos plans a dedicated program called KS-LES (Lunar Energy Station Space Complex). It consists of three heavy spacecraft to be launched between 2033 and 2035. The first two missions will each deliver a 400-kilogram lunar rover tasked with scouting and preparing the site. The third mission will land a 1.2-ton fission reactor, which the rovers will he

item.title: Nigerian and Russian forces prevent airport attack in Niamey
item.description: On the night of January 30, 2026, Niamey, the capital of Niger, experienced an attempted terrorist infiltration targeting the Diori Hamani International Airport. Gunfire and explosions near Air Base 101 triggered an immediate military response. According to the government, the attackers were mercenaries, some of whom were quickly neutralized. General Abdourahamane Tiani personally visited the site to oversee operations and meet with key military officers. He highlighted the crucial support of Russian forces, which helped contain the attack in under twenty minutes, preventing severe damage. General Tiani also emphasized the importance of continued vigilance and strengthened coordination with Russian partners to safeguard strategic airport infrastructure. In his statement, he suggested that certain foreign nations, including France and neighboring countries, may have supported the mercenaries. The military leadership, including the Minister of Defense and chiefs of staff from various bra

item.title: Dutch Artist Toon Joosen Reimagines Language Through Playful Paper Collage
item.description:
The article highlights the imaginative work of Dutch artist Toon Joosen, whose collage practice blends visual art, language, and nostalgia into playful, thought-provoking scenes. By repurposing old books, printed pages, and vintage photographs, Joosen transforms static text into lively visual narratives that give words a physical presence.
